title: Imco Recycling Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CHRONICLE
description: Name that tune? If it was sung in any English language movie made since the introduction of talkies in 1928, chances are that ARTHUR ROSENBLATT, an architect and the associate director of the Bryant Park Restoration Corporation, and his wife, RUTH BENJAMIN, a writer, can.

title: Review/Theater: Timon of Athens; From Rich Altruist To Ranting Hermit
description: IN its first two years, under the directorship of Tony Randall, the National Actors Theater developed the unenviable reputation of a company that could turn gold into dross. According to most reviews, such dramatic masterworks as "The Crucible" and "The Seagull" seemed to shrivel into abject clunkiness. While its production of "Saint Joan" last season received muted critical approval, few people expected inspirational lightning to strike the Lyceum, where the troupe is now based, at least not for some time.

title: Amrion Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share net reflects a 3-for-2 stock split on Sept. 15, 1993.

title: Anna Sui Pounds Out the Beat
description: Today's question is "Who will wear all those baby-doll dresses designers are showing for spring?" They're decidedly not meant for the nursery-school set nor for a fashionable sophisticate. Who then?

title: Old Republic International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 8.6 million, or 15 cents a primary share, from accounting changes.c-Included tax recoveries of $ 1.1 million and related interest credits of $ 11.8 million from resolution of various Internal Revenue Service disputes, and a charge of $ 10 million to provide additional funding in excess of normal claim provisions for various title escrow claims. The charges and credits resulted in a net gain of $ 2.9 million, or 5 cents a share.

title: Be Careful Turning Corners In Dallas
description: The Dallas Cowboys' starting cornerbacks, Kevin Smith and Larry Brown, took opposite routes to the National Football League. Smith's trip was like a heel-clicking waltz down the Yellow Brick Road compared to Brown's journey. Brown's was simply like running into a brick wall.

title: Wendy's International reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 14,000 from the early extinguishment of debt.The company's 9 months' results for 1992 covered 40 weeks ended Oct. 4.

title: Watermelon in Gaza
description: To the Editor:

title: Reynolds & Reynolds reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 19,106,000 reflecting the impact of company's adoption of new accounting standards for postretirement benefits.c-After a gain of $ 1.1 million, or 5 cents a share, reflecting the impact of company's adoption of new accounting standards for income taxes.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Markets

title: Possible Link Examined in Cabby Slayings
description: A single assailant, wanted in the wounding of a taxi driver last month, may also be responsible for the killing of two other drivers over the last few weeks, police investigators said yesterday.

title: American Water Works Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Jets' Mitchell a Tight End With Loose Lips
description: Tight end Johnny Mitchell would be a senior at Nebraska right now had he not opted for the National Football League draft as a sophomore in 1991. After two years with the Jets, the first-round draft pick is just a manchild in the rough and tumble N.F.L., a physically gifted athlete still struggling with the nuances of the game and the politics of the locker room.

title: Peres Hinting at Another Israeli-Arab Accord
description: Israel's Foreign Minister, Shimon Peres, has dropped broad hints of a possible breakthrough in peace negotiations with another Arab country. But he played down intense speculation in the press here today of an approaching agreement comparable to the one that Israel signed two months ago with the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: Review/Film; New Twist: Your Kidney or Your Life
description: Maybe there are many screenwriters who daydream about stepping into their own stories to find a deeper meaning and fundamental truth. Luckily, most of them have the sense to let the whim pass. Not Charlie Pope (Miguel Ferrer), the tough-guy hero of "The Harvest," who ventures to Mexico to do some research after certain studio types are less than charitable about his latest oeuvre. "They'd treated me like a hack," he mutters, in a voice-over meant to heighten the film noir atmosphere. "But frankly, at that point I wasn't so sure they were wrong."

title: Abroad at Home; If Nafta Loses
description: It is as a symbol that the North American Free Trade Agreement really matters. The economic effects of the agreement on this country would be marginal. But if Congress turns Nafta down, the political consequences would be enormous.

title: Morgan Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Cambridge NeuroScience Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Fear of H.I.V.-Infected Blood Spreads Past German Borders
description: A furor over charges that a German company distributed H.I.V.-infected blood, perhaps knowingly, to dozens of hospitals is causing anxiety throughout Germany, and it spread today to other European countries where hospitals also bought blood from the accused company.

title: Beukeboom Grants Keenan His Big Wish
description: Two days after he traded defenseman James Patrick, the player furthest out of favor with Coach Mike Keenan, Rangers General Manager Neil Smith managed to sign holdout Jeff Beukeboom, the defenseman Keenan has longed to see in a New York jersey.

title: Goodbye, Michael. See You Soon.
description: Dear Michael Jordan,

description: b-Included a gain from adoption of FASB 109 of $ 2,949,000, or 10 cents a share.c-Included an extraordinary tax credit of $ 300,000, or 1 cent a share, in the quarter and $ 1,350,000, or 3 cents a share, in the 9 months.

title: Review/Film; Finishing Symphony Called Life
description: Since his vintage years with Ingmar Bergman, Max Von Sydow has seemingly worked without stop around the world playing roles that don't come up to his instep, wrestling with Satan in "The Exorcist" and suffering serenely as God's son in "The Greatest Story Ever Told." With the exception of "Hannah and Her Sisters" and "Pelle the Conqueror," he hasn't had much to do recently except collect his paychecks. He's one of the cinema's great underused resources.

title: Universal Holding Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Universal Holding said that its earnings were increased by the sale on June 30, through reinsurance, of 90 perent of a block of life insurance policies issued by American Pioneer Life Insurance Co., which the company acquired on May 26, 1993.As reported, the sale resulted in a profit of $ 985,000 after amortization of the related present value of future profit. The 1993 figures include operating results of American Pioneer Life from May 26, 1993 to Sept. 30, 1993.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Charles Schwab Corp., San Francisco, has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell $100 million in debt securities. * Massachusetts Health and Educational Facilities Authority is selling $129.8 million in tax-exempt revenue bonds priced to yield a maximum 5.68 percent for an issue due in 2023 through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Co. Serial bonds with shorter maturities are priced to yield from 2.70 percent in 1994 to 4.20 percent in 1998, 4.80 percent in 2003, 5.25 percent in 2008 and 5.40 percent in 2010. Another long-term bond due in 2014 is offered at a price to yield 5.50 percent, while another due in 2018 is priced to yield about 5.648 percent. The bonds, which are for Boston College, are rated A-1 by Moody's Investors Service Inc. and A+ by Standard & Poor's Corp.

title: Relaxed Florio Regrets Little Except Losing
description: Relaxed, self-effacing and uncharacteristically jovial, Gov. Jim Florio made his first public appearance today since his re-election defeat and blamed the loss on a late surge of support by undecided voters for a tax-cut plan by his opponent, Christine Todd Whitman.

title: As Rates Rise, Signs of a Shakeout Grow; Plunge in Bonds Threatens to Halt A Yearlong Rally
description: The plunge in the bond market over the last week, which pushed the yield on the 30-year bond up to 6.17 percent yesterday, has been a little like the fires in California. Selling has swept the market like wind-driven flames while traders and investors watched, stunned and unable to stop it.

title: Immunomedics Inc.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Japan Stocks Continue Slide
description: Stocks plunged today on mounting concerns about the economy, traders said, continuing a selloff that began earlier in the week.

title: Stepan Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $ 5,406,000, or $ 1.00 a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Fresh Talents Dish Up Tasty Design
description: The seating at fashion shows is divvied up as though for a tug-of-war across the runway: buyers on one side, journalists on the other. And designers sending their clothes down the catwalk are caught in between. Should they please the news media with tumultuous change, or please the buyers with a gentle evolution of what sold last year?

title: Open Season on Nets as Nets Open
description: The Nets open their season tonight in Houston against the Rockets, and few people give them a chance to be serious contenders, but don't say that too loudly.

title: Misdemeanor for Coleman, Then He'll Help at Fire Site
description: The Vince Coleman firecracker saga will be resolved on Friday.

Senate Vote Breaks Crime Bill Impasse
description: The Senate voted 94 to 4 to set up a $22 billion trust fund to provide local governments with 100,000 new police officers over five years and money to build regional prisons to house the most violent inmates.

title: Malibu Fire Controlled, And the Sleepy Rejoice
description: When word passed along the line, just before dawn today, that the dangerous fire that ravaged Malibu had been brought under control, a throaty cheer went up among the exhausted firefighters.

title: Italy's High Drama
description: After 20 months of scandal and sensation, arrests and investigation, this is a country that has reviled its politicians and jailed its businessmen, defrocked its spies and sullied its generals. It is a land that has sunk into fretting and worry over a rash of bombings, over unsolved mysteries that return to haunt it, over daily disclosures of official wrongdoing that suggest nothing will get better before it gets worse.

Primerica Team Would Manage Travelers
description: The Primerica Corporation, which has said it will change its name to Travelers if it completes the acquisition of the insurer as expected later this year, has not included any Travelers executives in the top ranks of the new company.

title: Merrill Lynch Offers Settlement to Real Estate Investors
description: Investors in a real estate partnership widely sold by Merrill Lynch & Company have been offered a settlement that would return to them less than 2 cents on every dollar of their original investment.

title: U.S. Troops to Help Clear Roadblocks in Somalia
description: American soldiers in Somalia will use newly arrived tanks and armored personnel carriers to assist United Nations forces in clearing roadblocks from the streets of Mogadishu, the Pentagon said today.

description: Finally, the waiting has ended.

description: Gains and Losses at the Met

description: b-After payments for preferred dividends of $ 4,005,000, the net applicable to common shares was $ 11,870,000, in the quarter, and after payments for preferred dividends of $ 12,049,000, the net applicable to common shares was $ 21,685,000, in the 9 months.c-After payments for preferred dividends of $ 4,046,000, the net applicable to common shares was $ 19,256,000, in the quarter and after payments for preferred dividends of $ 12,146,000, the net applicable to common shares was $ 24,780,000, in the 9 months. The 9 months was also after a gain of $ 4,025,000, or 40 cents a share, from a change in accounting for income taxes.

title: Art in Review
description: 'Dreams and Shadows' 'Thomas H. Hotchkiss in 19th-Century Italy' National Academy of Design 1083 Fifth Avenue (at 89th Street) Through Jan. 16

title: A Pro-Trade Cabinet Takes Office in Canada
description: Jean Chretien formally took office today as Canada's 20th Prime Minister, and he immediately named a moderate, pragmatic Cabinet that is unlikely to walk away from free trade with the United States and Mexico.

title: Review/Film; Building a Future on a Shaky Past
description: "Bone" isn't a word that often turns up in movie titles. As used by the writer and director Steve Kloves in "Flesh and Bone," it suggests something tough, ominous and strikingly deliberate, qualities that perfectly capture the mood of Mr. Kloves's transfixing second feature. Although this film's story and setting locate it light-years away from "The Fabulous Baker Boys," his earlier romance steeped in world-weary diffidence and late-night glamour, these two films have a lot in common. They share the sharp stylistic imprint of a young film maker who is no longer merely going places. He has arrived.

title: The Prodigal Breakfast Returns to New York
description: BREAKFAST has long been New York's forgotten meal. "No time, gotta run" is the morning mantra for many New Yorkers, and the result is a city of people biting through the plastic covers of their coffee cups while they bounce on the subway, or trying not to get cream cheese all over their papers as they unwrap rolls at their desks.

title: Giuliani Starts Assembling City Hall Transition Team
description: Rudolph W. Giuliani, the Mayor-elect, began yesterday offering prominent campaign supporters key roles on the transition team that will be putting together his government and helping shape policy for City Hall.

title: Ion Laser Technology Inc.  (ECM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossIon Laser Technology attributed the increase in sales in the latest second quarter to the company's Precision Curing System product.

title: In a Court, A Seminar On Conflict In Ulster
description: The case of an escaped fugitive from Northern Ireland that started as the first test of a new extradition rule between the United States and Britain has turned into much more.

title: Capitol American Financial Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Capitol American said that the impact of the recent federal tax increase is an additional $ 439,000 of current income tax and a one-time increase in net deferred tax liability of $ 1,073,000. Without the impact of the tax rate increase, net income for quarter would have been $ 12,427,000, or 67 cents a share.The company also said its latest third quarter also included realized capital gains of $ 497,000 resulting from the sale of nonutility corporate fixed income investments and gains from the call of certain preferred stocks.

title: Age Will Be Served
description: At 65, BOB COUSY says he has just reached the speed limit of age and now that the National Basketball Association All-Star Game will no longer feature an old-timers game, he needs a new arena in which to dish out the assists that made him legendary. He appeared at the Marriott Marquis Hotel in Manhattan as the formation of one was announced yesterday.

title: K N Energy reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossShare earnings and shares outstanding reflects a 3-for-2 stock split distributed Oct. 4, 1993 to shareholders of record on Sept. 15, 1993.

title: Sweet Mystery of Life, At Last I've Found It
description: Beavis and Butt-head were rewarded this week for renewing their Rangers season tickets. In a trade, the Blues dealt off two skilled and popular skaters and gained a certified goon who was unavailable to fight for the Rangers right away because he was under suspension.

title: Review/Film: Remains of the Day; Blind Dignity: A Butler's Story
description: IN the late 1930's, in a stately home of England called Darlington Hall, Stevens (Anthony Hopkins) is the butler. He's the supreme commander of a vast staff that includes the housekeeper, the underbutlers, the cooks, the maids, the footmen, the scullery helpers, even those people who work outside the great house. As the members of his staff are expected to serve him, so Stevens serves his master, Lord Darlington (James Fox). He serves without question. Or, as he says at one point, "It's not my place to have an opinion."

title: Union to Get Trustee
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office and a national plumbers union yesterday agreed to the appointment of a trustee to run a New York City local whose top officials were indicted last month on corruption charges. Under the court agreement, 10 current and former officers of Local 2 of the Plumbers Union will be removed or barred from holding office by the local's parent organization, the United Association of Journeymen and Apprentices of the Pipe Fitting Industry of the United States and Canada.

title: Robert Jacobs, 88, An Architect Noted For Asphalt Plant
description: Robert Allan Jacobs, who practiced architecture in New York for 40 years, died yesterday at his home in Pawling, N.Y. He was 88.

title: Sales Data Offer Few Clues To Stores' Holiday Prospects
description: There was little consistency in the October sales figures reported yesterday by most of the major retail chains, leaving merchants with few hints about how they will fare during the critical holiday sales season.

title: Devils Happy to See Ducks
description: At least the Mighty Ducks are next.

title: Cineplex Odeon reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $ 7,349,000 and $ 8,341,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, both included a loss on the sale of discontinued operations of $ 6,998,000.c-Net lossd-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 315,000 in the quarter and $ 1,274,000 in the 9 months.

title: Article 446793 -- No Title
description: Abdul B. Khan took enough pride in the Afghan-Persian restaurant he opened in April to give it his own name. And he made sure the restaurant lived up to the name.

title: Jurors Tell Tales of Woe and Outrage
description: The young woman in the white suit nervously took her seat at the witness table to address the stern-faced panel. "My name is Deirdre Kane," she began. Then, with a vengeful gleam, she said, "And I am a refugee from the jury system."

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: TENNIS Sampras, Becker Gain Top-seeded Pete Sampras and the three-time champion Boris Becker, seeded third, advanced to the quarterfinals of the $2.1 million Paris Open with straight-set victories today. Sampras beat Marc Rosset of Switzerland, 7-5, 6-3. Becker kept alive his undefeated streak in the tournament by defeating Karel Novacek of the Czech Republic, 7-6 (11-9), 6-2. (AP) Garrison-Jackson Overcomes Nerves Even though Tracy Austin's comeback attempt is still in the fledgling stage, the prospect of facing the former two-time United States Open champion made Zina Garrison-Jackson nervous. Even though Austin, 30, is back on the tour after a 10-year layoff, when Garrison-Jackson stepped onto the court Wednesday night to play her in the second round of the Bank of the West Classic, in Oakland, Calif., she wanted to play her best. She did, losing only 2 points on her serve in winning the first set, 6-0, and then taking the second, 6-2, in a match that lasted 55 minutes. (AP) GOLF Magee Leads Kapalua Andrew Magee, recording a birdie and eagle on consecutive holes, shot a six-under-par 67 to take the first-round lead yesterday at the Kapalua International in Hawaii. Scott Hoch, Peter Jacobsen and Noland Henke were two strokes back at the Kapalua Resort on the island of Maui. (AP)

title: Household International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Shares outstanding are adjusted for a 2-for-1 stock split Oct. 15.Latest quarter's share earnings are reduced by 13 cents a share, consisting of 5 cents a share from issuance of 4 million common shares, 5 cents due to the new federal tax rate and 3 cents from the adoption of new accounting standards for postretirement benefits.Latest 9 months' share earnings are reduced by 24 cents a share consisting of 11 cents a share from issuance of 4 million common shares, 5 cents due to the new federal tax rate and 8 cents from the adoption of new accounting standards for postretirement benefits.

title: Corrections
description: Because of a computer malfunction, an article in some editions yesterday about indications that a defendant charged in a bombing plot had agreed to become a witness for the Government included a scrambled passage. It should have read: "The situation is expected to be cleared up today when defendants in the second bombing case convene for a pretrial conference before judge Michael B. Mukasey. Mr. Haggag's absence would be a strong indication he is no longer a defendant."

title: British Rape Case Stirs Call to Not Identify Accused
description: After a much-publicized court case in which a defendant accused of rape was found not guilty, Britain's senior judge has come out in favor of a change in the law to allow a defendant in a rape case to remain unidentified in the press unless and until he is convicted.

title: As Rates Rise, Signs of a Shakeout Grow; Stocks in Selloff For Second Day; Dow Loses 36.89
description: With their anxiety over rising interest rates apparently snowballing, investors hacked away at the stock market for a second day yesterday, forcing one of the most sweeping selloffs of the year.

title: CenCall Communications Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Settlement Backed in Texas on G.M. Pickups
description: A Texas state judge approved a settlement on Tuesday under which the General Motors Corporation will give $1,000 coupons to 645,000 owners of older pickups that Federal safety officials say may pose a fire hazard.

title: Critic's Notebook; Of Mystics, Minimalists and Musical Miasmas
description: "It does not invoke the history of music," Virgil Thomson once wrote of Erik Satie's "Mass for the Poor," composed in 1895. "Its inner life is as independent of you as a Siamese cat." Classical music has been somewhat overrun in recent years by Siamese cats. The halting, hushed, minimal, liturgical manner that occupied Satie toward the end of the 19th century has come round with a vengeance. Composers have perfected a mysterious, glassy gaze, writing as if the history of music were at an end.

title: Serv-Tech Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Police Assault Charged
description: Manchester United's ERIC CANTONA and BRYAN ROBSON said yesterday that they were assaulted by Turkish police officers after the team's elimination from the European Champions Cup in Istanbul, Turkey, Wednesday night.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: HIGHER HEALTH-CARE COSTS

title: Key Tronic Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-After a gain of $ 8,750,000 from an accounting adjustment.

title: More Information Units Will Be Sold by Nynex
description: The Nynex Corporation, continuing with its plan to leave the information services business, said yesterday that it had agreed to sell several units of AGS Computers Inc. for undisclosed terms.

title: Dinkins to Leave for a Vacation And, on Return, to Plan Future
description: Mayor David N. Dinkins is scheduled to leave today for a one-week vacation in Puerto Rico. Some of the Mayor's friends and aides say that when he returns he will begin to confront important questions about his future, ranging from where he and Mrs. Dinkins will live to what the Mayor will do when he leaves office in January.

title: Strawberry to the Royals?
description: DARRYL STRAWBERRY may get to move from Los Angeles after all. Not quite the way he envisions it, however. The Dodgers are working on a trade that may send him to the Kansas City Royals, The Los Angeles Times reported yesterday.

title: Diversity's Down Side; Image and Reality Clash in a New Jersey Town, and Hispanic Residents Feel the Impact
description: The men who used to gather in front of stores here to shoot the breeze are gone, brushed off the streets in recent weeks in police sweeps that made loitering seem like a major crime.

title: Subsidizing Coastal Mansions
description: In 1968, Congress passed a law that was supposed to discourage development in the nation's most flood-prone areas. But Federal Emergency Management Agency failures, along with a program of heavily subsidized insurance that has delighted the real estate industry, is having exactly the opposite effect.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: BITECH CORP., Toronto, a resource development company, said it had paid $5 million to acquire a sixth oilfield in Russia for its Silur Co. subsidiary. BUTLER MANUFACTURING, Kansas City, Mo., has reached a definitive agreement to sell its Walker Electrical Products division to Wiremold Co. of West Hartford, Conn., for $35 million.

title: Phoenix Re Corp. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss, and the 9 months was after a gain of $ 433,000, or 11 cens a share, from an adjustment in accounting.Per-share amounts in all periods follow preferred dividends.Phoenix Re had realized investment losses of $ 271,000 in the latest quarter, compared with a gain of $ 123,000, or 2 cents a share, in year-ago period. Realized investment losses for the latest 9 months were $ 465,000, compared with a gain of $ 272,000, or 5 cents a share, in year-ago period.

title: Breaking Impasse on Crime Bill, Senate Supports $22 Billion Plan
description: In a breakthrough on a big anticrime measure, the Senate tonight voted 94 to 4 to set up a $22 billion trust fund to provide localities with 100,000 new police officers over five years and money to build regional prisons to house the nation's most violent inmates.

title: Olsten Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
description: b-Included after-tax merger and restructuring costs of $ 58.7 million, consisting of transaction costs, compensation and severance costs, asset write-downs and integration costs. The periods were also after an extraordinary after-tax charge of $ 14,668,000, related to prepayment of Lifetime Corp. debt.c-Net income, and the 9 months included after-tax merger and restructuring costs of $ 7,125,000.Results for the period reflected the combined operations of Olsten and Lifetime, which completed their merger, accounted for as a pooling of interests, on July 30, 1993. Comparisons with last year's performance are based on restated combined results.Year-ago periods ended Sept. 27.Revenue represented service sales by company and licensed offices, franchise fees and other income.

title: On My Mind; Sidewalks: Clinton and Giuliani
description: The Dinkins mayoralty campaign in New York City was rich in celebrities, a whole glitter of them -- singers, actors, big-name politicians, rappers, comedians, and of course the two greatest superstars of all, Bill Clinton and Barbra Streisand.

title: Nanny Case Hears Expert In Child Abuse
description: A 10-month-old baby who suffered a fatal skull fracture while in a nanny's care may have been abused on two prior occasions, a child-abuse expert testified in a pretrial hearing today.

title: The Packwood Disgrace
description: The scene in the Senate chamber was ugly. Bob Packwood, fighting for his political life, forced his peers to take him to court for his diaries and papers. A few senators concocted a civil liberties case against compelling Senator Packwood to produce diaries that he himself had invoked in his own defense against sexual misconduct charges. Only the final vote of 94 to 6 to enforce the Ethics Committee's subpoena redeemed the distasteful two-day debate.

title:
Moscow Journal;
For the Faithful, a Resurrection on Red Square
description: Russian Orthodox believers gathered in Red Square today, genuflecting and shielding thin yellow candles from the chill wind, as religious and Government leaders offered prayers at the reconsecration of the newly rebuilt Cathedral of the Holy Mother of Kazan.

title: WITH RUSSIAN AID, BETTER SPACE LAB
description: An international space station built with substantial Russian participation would be larger, cheaper to construct and completed two years sooner than the previous proposal, space agency officials said today.

title: Gore and Perot Are Set to Debate Trade Accord
description: The White House dared Ross Perot today to debate Vice President Al Gore on the North American Free Trade Agreement before the House votes on it in two weeks, and Mr. Perot quickly accepted.

title: Rights Lawyer Defends Both Croats and Serbs
description: In the turmoil that has engulfed much of the former Yugoslavia over the last two years, the practice of law has also become precarious, particularly for those engaged in civil rights cases.

title: Policy Pitch to Silicon Valley
description: Returning to Silicon Valley, where the Clinton Administration introduced its technology policy early this year, Government officials huddled today with high-technology industry executives to demonstrate that the Administration remains committed to the "information infrastructure," "data superhighways" and other buzz concepts that make a techie's blood race.

title: Southern Electronics Corp.  (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago share earnings and shares outstanding were adjusted for 3-for-2 stock split paid February 1993.

title: Young Rider Learning Obstacles of Sport
description: Gaby Salick, a Princeton sophomore negotiating her first year of competition on the grand prix horse show circuit, was understandably unnerved when she aimed her horse at a 7-foot wall last Saturday night in Washington in her successful first attempt to win a Puissance event.

title: Markel Corp. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included nonrecurring gain of $ 13.8 million, or $ 2.50 a share, from sale of the company's Governmental Programs division, and a nonrecurring $ 3.3 million after-tax provision for the relocation of the company's Markel Rhulen Underwriters division.Latest periods' results included benefit of $ 200,000, or 3 cents a share, from the net effect of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993.

title: Rockland to Investigate Scandal-Tainted Utility
description: Rockland County's gas and electric utility has agreed to cooperate in a criminal investigation of embezzlement and illegal campaign contributions and to open its books to examination by independent investigators, the company and the Rockland County District Attorney announced yesterday.

title: Elcotel reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit from early extinguishment of bank debt of $ 1,973,000, or 33 cents a share, in the quarter and 6 months.c-Net loss

title: A Whitaker-Chavez II Bid
description: Pernell Whitaker, the welterweight champion who seemingly outfought Julio Cesar Chavez in a controversial draw on Sept. 10, will make a multi-million-dollar offer to Chavez for a rematch.

title: Voters Amend Constitution
description: Voters in New York State on Tuesday approved three proposals regarding the handling of debt.

title: A Cop Stalks Trouble, Right There in Motor City
description: It is not a good sign that Peter Weller, who originated the title role of the cyborg police officer in the hit movie "Robocop" and its sequel is not around for Part 3. In the latest episode of the series, which seems to have nearly run out of steam, he is portrayed by Robert John Burke, an actor who bears some resemblance to Mr. Weller while lacking his forerunner's tongue-in-cheek glint of authoritarian machismo.

title: Panel Reports Genetic Screening Has Cost Some Their Health Plans
description: Some American workers have already lost their jobs and others their health insurance on the basis of information obtained through genetic screening, a panel of the National Academy of Sciences said today.

title: U.S. Should Match Europe's Shorter Workweek; Illusory Recovery
description: To the Editor:

title: INSIDE
description: Neglecting Gifted Students

title: Michael's Week Ends On Maybe and What If
description: Gene Michael was probably the only general manager working at the general managers' meetings this week without a contract. But he was apparently well ahead of some of his colleagues in his readiness to make deals.

title: Piedmont Management Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $ 6,937,545, or $ 1.27 a share, from a change in accounting for income taxes.c-Net lossPiedmont Management said that its latest results included after-tax realized capital gains on sales of securities of 29 cents a share in the quarter and 84 cents a share in the 9 months.In the third quarter of 1992, Piedmont's after-tax capital gain was 27 cents a share, and 46 cents a share for the year-ago 9 months.The company said it also recorded a gain of 8 cents a share in the latest third quarter resulting from the revaluation of current and deferred tax balances in light of the new federal income tax law.

title: David A. Hungerford Dies at 66; Found Genetic Change in Cancer
description: Dr. David A. Hungerford, a co-discoverer of the first visible genetic abnormality in cancer cells, died on Wednesday at his home in Jenkintown, Pa. He was 66.

title: Firearms Agency Struggles to Rise From Ashes of Waco Raid
description: After the worst year in its long history, the small Federal agency that ran the botched February raid on the cult near Waco, Tex., is trying to pick itself up.

title: Iranians, Marking '79 Crisis, Assail U.S. as Rift Again Widens
description: Iranians today celebrated the 14th anniversary of the seizure of the United States Embassy in Teheran with blistering anti-American speeches and demonstrations that appear to be part of a widening rift between Washington and Teheran.

title: A Marketer Is Chosen By Interactive Network
description: Peter Sealey, a former Coca-Cola marketing executive, yesterday was named president and chief operating officer of Interactive Network Inc., a Silicon Valley start-up company that runs an interactive television service.

title: Bonn Bans U.S.-Russian Games in Germany
description: It started out as a bright idea to strengthen ties between the American and Russian military. But so far it has strained relations with Washington's key European allies.

title: TRANSACTIONS
description: BASEBALL American League MILWAUKEE BREWERS -- Declined to exercise its 1994 option on Robin Yount, outfielder.

title: BellSouth May Join QVC Bid
description: The BellSouth Corporation is close to signing a deal to invest at least $2 billion in QVC Network Inc.'s bid for Paramount Communications Inc., two executives with knowledge of the discussions said yesterday.

title: Review/Film; Cowboy Mythos In London
description: The appeal of American cowboy mythology is so potent that almost anybody can succumb to it. That is one of the themes of "Wild West," an antic romp about three Pakistani brothers in London who form a country-and-western band called the Honky Tonk Cowboys.

description: b-After a gain of $ 36,095, or 1 cent a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: While Senator Deliberated, a Top Aide Politicked
description: At the same time that Senator Orrin G. Hatch had been saying publicly that he had not made up his mind about a Clinton Administration judicial nominee, one of his a top aides began distributing damaging material about her which supporters characterized as a smear campaign.

title: Under Senate Streamlining Plan, The Powerful Would Be Less So
description: The Senate made public today its half of a long-promised plan to rid Congress of lethargy and bloat, in large part by halving the Senate's huge flock of subcommittees and writing a Federal budget every two years instead of annually.

title: Graff Pay-Per-View reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net incomeYear-ago results are restated to conform to current period's presentation.

title: A Stronger Yen Is Hurting Sales Of Japan's Cars
description: The Big Three may still be complaining in Washington and Tokyo that prices of Japanese cars and trucks are suspiciously low. But Japanese prices have risen faster than those of American auto makers, and in the marketplace the Americans have not hesitated to crow about why.

title: Bowe Shadowboxes: Tyson Is the Shadow
description: Riddick Bowe warmed to his subject himself -- this morning. In only two more days he will defend his heavyweight crown against Evander Holyfield, the fighter he needs to beat convincingly to give him, and others, further perspective on his place in boxing history.

title: Ripples in an Election
description: The elections on Tuesday were not about President Clinton, and certainly not about the North American Free Trade Agreement. But some in Washington think the results will make it harder for President Clinton to prevail when the North American Free Trade Agreement comes up for a decisive vote in about two weeks.

description: European stock markets plummeted today after a yearlong climb that has taken many exchanges to record levels.

title: Review/Fashion; SoHo's Night of the Living Fashion Hounds
description: On Thursday night, while the empty Bryant Park tents were being swept, unrest was rumbling in SoHo as the cabals that had been forming over the course of fashion week roamed from show to show to show. If there was change to be found in New York fashion, the unspoken pact went, it would be here.

description: Armand P. D'Amato, who was convicted of mail fraud in payments he received from a military contractor to lobby his brother, Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato, was sentenced today to five months in prison and five months in home detention.

title: My Brother the Clone
description: A man and woman are in the office of a doctor who specializes in in vitro fertilization, facing a screen on which slides of youngsters are being projected. They hope to choose one who can serve as a prototype for their own child. The doctor, who is showing the slides, is also delivering a running commentary.

description: A popular suicide manual has had a noticeable effect on the methods people use to kill themselves in New York City and nationally, research has shown.

title: Pennies From Heaven? Federal Reserve Doesn't Think So
description: If you have a coffee can full of pennies, there is only one place in New York City you can go that is legally obligated to redeem them: the Federal Reserve Bank.

title: Review/Fashion; Visions of Victoriana
description: Richard Tyler was in command yesterday. In the Anne Klein collection he showed earlier this week, his skills were put to work to update a traditional sportswear company. In his own Richard Tyler collection, he could give free rein to his own vision. And a beautiful vision it was.

description: The red dirt road that twists up the hill to this Zulu village is a route of ambushes, assassinations, flights and funeral processions marking the factional feuds of South Africa's largest tribe.

description: An article in Your Money last Saturday about Stuart Kessler, a financial planner, misstated the address of Goldstein Golub Kessler & Company in Manhattan. It is at 1185 Avenue of the Americas, not on Park Avenue.

description: Results are in Canadian dollars.The company is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange.

description: As American reinforcements continue to land in Somalia, the greatest battle is not against militias but against boredom, anxiety and the blistering heat of the Somali capital.

title: Reports of Elder Abuse Flow in a Tragic Stream
description: LIKE everything else here, the pathology of nastiness in New York is dynamic. It needs new terms to identify new strains, new campaigns to point out the problems and advise what can be done about them. Take the case of elder abuse.

title: Jose Ramos Lopez, 79, Former Assemblyman
description: Jose Ramos Lopez, the first Puerto Rican Democrat elected to the New York State Assembly from Manhattan, who went on to serve nearly 20 years as a judge, died on Thursday in a hospital in San Juan, Puerto Rico. He was 79 and lived in Bellerose, Queens, and Puerto Rico.

Review/Film; World's Weierdos in Microcosm, Near a Freudian Forest
description: It's no wonder the residents of the grotesque, unfinished housing development where Alex van Warmerdam has set his surreal comedy, "The Northerners," are an unbalanced lot. The place is little more than a row of modern houses and a few shops on the edge of a forest somewhere in the Netherlands. Just to get to church, which is miles away, the residents must line up every Sunday morning to take a bus.

title: Strict New Test On Car Exhaust Set in New York
description: To make the air cleaner, life will soon get more complicated for the owners of 5.8 million cars and other vehicles in New York City and vicinity.

description: To the consternation of Nielsen Marketing Research North America, the consumer tracking company, the chief executive it recently lured from its arch-rival, Information Resources Inc., jumped back to I.R.I. today.

She is the F.B.I. agent who has been in the news lately for charging that she was sexually harassed by her superior, then retaliated against.

title: Perot Debate Seen as Way To Try to Save Trade Pact
description: The White House strategy in challenging Ross Perot to a debate on the North American Free Trade Agreement is based on a calculation that the trade measure is in trouble in Congress and can be rescued if the opposition can be closely identified with Mr. Perot, President Clinton's advisers said today.

title: 88 Picassos Sold at Auction, Some Far Beyond Estimates
description: Sotheby's has always been a company known for taking risks, and its sale of 88 Picassos from the Stanley J. Seeger collection on Thursday night was a risk well taken. Every lot sold, with some works bringing double their estimates. One drawing brought five times as much as expected.

description: In an unusually somber assessment of relations between France and the United States, Foreign Minister Alain Juppe said today that disagreements in world trade talks were poisoning the alliance between the two countries while sharp differences also persisted over the new role of NATO.

title: Bombing-Plot Defendants Criticize Treatment in Jail
description: Ibrahim A. Elgabrowny has come to despise orange -- the color of his jail jumpsuit. Tarig El-Hassan says he is still waiting for new glasses to replace the pair he lost when the F.B.I. arrested him. And Clement Hampton-El says he works five hours a day swabbing floors, his only escape from what would be 23 hours a day of solitary confinement.

The Pre-Game Line Is Cowboys, by a Sentence and Three Words

Don't give the opposition -- in this case, the Dallas Cowboys -- any additional ammunition. Don't add fuel to the fire. No need to help them. Be smart.

title: Corrections
description: Articles on Sept. 27 and Oct. 20 about the Virginia Military Institute's plan to settle a sex-discrimination suit misstated the Supreme Court's action on the case. The Court refused to hear an appeal by the institute; it did not uphold a lower-court ruling, which said the State of Virginia must offer a similar program for women.

title: Giuliani Says He Might Keep Minority Contracts Program
description: Taking his message of reconciliation to areas of New York City that supported his opponent, Rudolph W. Giuliani said yesterday that he would reconsider his pledge to abolish the Dinkins administration program that directs a share of city contracts to minorities and women.

title: Rates Hint at Last Call For Home Refinancing
description: HOMEOWNERS and potential home buyers who have delayed taking a new mortgage while waiting for the absolutely lowest rates may be waiting in vain.

title: Some Brokers' Pitches That Raise Red Flags
description: TRUST us. That's the message stock brokerage firms convey through millions of dollars of advertising each year. Now Prudential Securities will spend hundreds of millions of dollars to compensate investors who did just that.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article yesterday about a proposal to stage joint Russian-United States military exercises in Germany included an incorrect conversion from German marks to dollars in some editions. The equivalent of 13.4 billion marks, the amount being paid by Germany to Russia to defray the cost of relocating 337,000 Russian troops who had been stationed in eastern Germany, is $7.9 billion, not $788 million.

title:
HORSE RACING;
Breeders' Cup Focuses on Horses' Health
description: The 82 horses scheduled to run in Saturday's seven Breeders' Cup races at Santa Anita have been subjected to rigorous medical scrutiny this week because of the recent deaths of horses at thoroughbred races.

title: In-Your-Face Defense Is Dolphins' Face-Saver
description: Stung by a poor performance in its first meeting with the Jets this season, the Miami Dolphins' defense plans to smother Jets' quarterback Boomer Esiason when the two teams meet Sunday in the Meadowlands.

title: Giuliani Asks Transition Team For a Conflict-of-Interest Pledge
description: Trying to avoid conflicts of interest, Mayor-elect Rudolph W. Giuliani said yesterday that he would ask anyone serving on his transition team to pledge not to do business with city agencies for six months after the transition.

title: Domtar Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included charges of $ 4 million and $ 22 million in the quarter and 9 months, respectively.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Suicide Doctor Is Jailed in Detroit Amid a Threat to Starve Himself
description: For the first time since he embarked three years ago on a campaign of physician-assisted suicide, Dr. Jack Kevorkian was jailed today.

title: 'So No One Will Suspect I'm Afraid'
description: To the Editor:

title: Arsenal Is Seized In Brooklyn Raid
description: A small arsenal of handguns, rifles, pipe bombs and thousands of rounds of ammunition was uncovered yesterday by Federal and city authorities in a raid on a house in Canarsie, Brooklyn, the authorities said. Four men were arrested on Federal explosives and weapons charges.

title: Effort to Save Haitian Talks Fails As Military Leaders Shun Meeting
description: An attempt to revive negotiations over Haiti's political future collapsed today when military leaders failed to show up for what was scheduled to be the start of two days of talks aimed at restoring the country's exiled President, the Rev. Jean-Bertrand Aristide.

title: Remodeling: First the Contract, Then the House
description: After 16 years in their Bethpage, L.I., ranch house, Bob and Maureen Sauer decided to remodel to extend their living space. The couple did not borrow but carefully budgeted so they could pay for the work as it was completed. They were concerned about any liability should the general contractor not pay all his bills and looked for one willing to meet their needs. "The important thing is to read the contract," Mr. Sauer said, "If the contractor is reliable, he'll work with you."

title: Review/Opera; Honoring Monteverdi Modestly
description: How enticing the prospect of a Monteverdi year appeared a mere eight years ago, when early musickers and conventional performers alike were tripping over one another to celebrate the big anniversaries of Bach, Handel, Scarlatti and even Heinrich Schutz. And how paltry and anticlimactic the commemorations of the 350th anniversary of Monteverdi's death have seemed this year, at least in New York.

title: Meadowlands Has Full Menu
description: Bettors in the New York metropolitan area looking for action on the Breeders' Cup races Saturday will find the best menu at the Meadowlands in East Rutherford, N.J. Fans will be able to bet on as many as 70 races and will be able to shop for odds through two separate Breeders' Cup pools.

title: Airline Worker Preparing Plane Is Killed Walking Into Propeller
description: An airline ground-crew worker at Newark Airport was killed this afternoon when she walked into the spinning propeller of a twin-engine aircraft preparing for takeoff.

title: Review/Fashion; From Manolo, Mermaids Disney Didn't Show You
description: Manolo's mermaids washed up on a sea-green magical boardwalk yesterday after a particularly violent storm. Their hair was tangled and matted, their faces scarred with flotsam and jetsam from their underwater journey.

title: John M. van Heusen Jr., Clothier, 96
description: John M. van Heusen Jr., a member of the family that established the Van Heusen shirt company, died Oct. 19 at his home in Clearwater, Fla. He was 96.

title: A Test of Retraining
description: When a Zenith television factory was relocated to Mexico last year, many laid-off employees entered Government-financed retraining programs. Their experiences may be a test case of the sort of retraining efforts promised by the Administration if the free-trade pact is approved.

title: POLICE ARREST 23 IN G.M. DRUG CASE
description: Twenty-three General Motors assembly line workers have been arrested for dealing cocaine and marijuana in two truck assembly plants, and the police are widening their investigation into drug dealing at other G.M. factories, law-enforcement officials said today.

title: U.S. APPROVES USE OF DRUG TO RAISE MILK PRODUCTION
description: After years of scientific and political conflict, the Federal Food and Drug Administration yesterday approved a genetically engineered drug that is intended to increase the amount of milk produced by dairy cows.

title: LOCKHEED MAY SELL 12 F-16'S TO PENTAGON IN FISCAL 1994
description: The Lockheed Corporation will probably receive orders for 12 F-16 jet fighters during the 1994 fiscal year, half the amount the Pentagon requested. The F-16 decision is part of the fiscal year 1994 Defense Department budget that Senate and House Armed Services Committee conferees hammered out Thursday night. Approval is expected next week.

title: Disarm Our Citizens

description: A White House official said today that Mayor David N. Dinkins would be a strong candidate for the ambassadorships to South Africa and to Jamaica, both of which are vacant.

title: Warming Up to Global Warming
description: President Clinton's new plan to control global warming looks a lot more like something George Bush would dream up than like anything straight from the heart of Al Gore, the environmental conscience of the Administration. The plan relies heavily on voluntary actions, goes light on regulatory actions and remains silent on the enormously difficult problem of what to do to head off a big increase in greenhouse gas emissions after the turn of the century.

title: AMERITECH JOINS BIDDING ON HUNGARIAN PHONE COMPANY
description: The Ameritech Corporation, the Chicago-based regional Bell operating company, said yesterday that it had joined a group that was bidding to buy part of the Hungarian state telephone company. Along with Deutsche Bundespost Telekom of Germany and Cable & Wireless P.L.C. of Britain, Ameritech wants to buy part of Matav, the Hungarian phone company. The Hungarian Government had announced it would sell about 30 percent of Matav this year.

title: Thomas Walker, 94, Politician and a Judge
description: Thomas G. Walker, a former vice president and general counsel for New Jersey Bell Telephone Company and a former Federal judge, died on Thursday at his home in New Vernon, N.J. He was 94.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: HOCKEY Capitals Beat Canucks Peter Bondra scored twice in the third period, including the go-ahead goal with 5 minutes 30 seconds remaining, as the Washington Capitals rallied to beat the Vancouver Canucks, 3-2, last night in Landover, Md. (AP)

title: Holyfield and History Converge on Champion
description: Evander Holyfield, a low-key man who never realized how much he wanted the heavyweight championship of the world until he lost it, fights history and the bigger, younger Riddick Bowe Saturday night.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day yesterday, about the Nynex Corporation's planned sale of some computer services businesses, misidentified the company in which Nynex invested $1.2 billion. The investment was in Viacom Inc., not QVC Network Inc.

title: German Official Denies Starting an AIDS Panic
description: The German Health Minister today rejected charges from several medical associations that he had contributed to a health panic by urging patients who suspect they have been infected by tainted blood to submit to tests for AIDS.

title: 90's Knock at Litton's Gilded Doors
description: After nearly 30 years, Litton Industries, the aerospace and weapons company, is leaving its palatial headquarters here and heading for a sterile office complex in the San Fernando Valley.

title: Body Language
description: No one has ever counted the number of prisoners with body tattoos in the Commonwealth of Independent States, as the loose association of 11 former Soviet republics is known. The Corrective Labor Administration remains silent because to admit that 70 to 98 percent of the prison population flouts prohibitions against tattoos would be an admission of how badly the system is functioning.

title: Badgers' Big Game Is Only A Game
description: The question would have been foolish in the early afternoon of a week ago Saturday, as the Wisconsin Badgers earned the long-sought victory over Michigan that created the highest stakes for a football game here in more than three decades. But the devastating scene that followed the game last weekend -- the crush of thousands of students in an out-of-control celebration, the hospitalization of 69 fans and the vigil as the critically injured began to recover -- has made the question inevitable:

title: Review/Jazz; Sonny Rollins, Beyond Context
description: The saxophonist Sonny Rollins presents what may just be jazz's most complicated puzzle. While he's one of the greatest improvisers walking this earth, he seems unable, or unwilling, to present himself in a context that would give dignity to his great ability, or even just accommodate it.

title: Shuffling Hollywood's Deal Deck
description: More than any other deal in recent history, the struggle for Paramount Communications Inc. is pitting the Hollywood deal makers against each other and putting their many relationships to the test.

title: Developers Diversified Realty Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago 9 months' revenues and latest and year-ago 9 months' share earnings are pro forma to reflect the effect of results of operations assuming the initial public offering had been completed Jan. 1, 1992.Developers Diversified Realty said that pro forma funds from operations for the quarter ended Sept. 30, 1993, were $ 6,005,000, or 52 cents a share, compared with $ 4,853,000, or 42 cents a share, a year ago.The company said pro forma funds from operations for the 9 months were $ 16,350,000, or $ 1.41 a share, compared with $ 13,494,000, or $ 1.16 a share, a year earlier.

title: BOSTON EDISON SHUTS NUCLEAR PLANT FOR WATER LEAKS
description: The Boston Edison Company said yesterday that it had shut its Pilgrim nuclear power plant to repair leaks in one of its water heaters. Workers at the plant discovered the leaks and took the plant off line about 6 A.M., Boston Edison said. Repairs on the heater, outside the nuclear core of the reactor, are expected to take about a week.

title: Republic New York Seeks A Merger With Green Point
description: The Republic New York Corporation said yesterday that it was making an unsolicited offer to merge with the Green Point Savings Bank of Brooklyn, in a move that would be the first hostile takeover bid for a mutual savings bank.

description: Captain TOM GULLIKSON's recruiting mission for the 1994 United States Davis Cup squad, which has a daunting first-round assignment in India next March and could play all its matches in other countries, took another turn yesterday when he learned that India may select clay, not grass, as its surface.

description: Whatever else the White House expects to get out of a mano a mano debate with Ross Perot over the North American Free Trade Agreement, the challenge has already given the gadfly Texan more prime-time publicity than his millions could buy.

title: Jobless Rate Rises to 7.9% In New York
description: New York State's unemployment rate rose to 7.9 percent in October from 7.1 percent in September, with the anemic New York City economy dragging down the rest of the state, the Government said yesterday.

title: U.S. Warns Libya of Oil Boycott Unless It Gives Up Bomb Suspects
description: The United States warned Libya today that it may face a global boycott of its oil if it does not hand over suspected terrorists. The warning came after Russia, under Western pressure, dropped its objections to a new set of Security Council sanctions against the North African oil-producing country.

description: Foreign Minister Andrei V. Kozyrev of Russia said today that the condition of nuclear warheads in Ukraine had sharply deteriorated and that some of them could lead to an incident worse than the accident at Chernobyl.

description: Bo Jackson, who made a remarkable physical comeback this year with an artificial hip, became a free agent yesterday after the Chicago White Sox decided not to exercise the 1994 option in his contract.

description: Most bond fund returns over the last three years have been extraordinary, thanks to a substantial drop in interest rates. Long-term rates have hit 25-year lows and short-term rates 30-year lows.

description: When Americans join a health maintenance organization, cost is almost always the driving force. Either their out-of-pocket medical payments have climbed too high or their employers are giving them a big incentive.

title: Opening of 'Perestroika' Is Delayed Until Nov. 23
description: After canceling several preview performances to allow more rehearsals, the producers of "Perestroika," Part 2 of Tony Kushner's "Angels in America," have postponed the opening until Nov. 23. The show was to have opened on Nov. 18 at the Walter Kerr Theater.

description: After two sessions of steep declines, the stock market mounted a mild recovery yesterday, as investors appeared to shake off some of their misgivings about rising interest rates.

description: The Newark police officer accused of ambushing and seriously wounding an unarmed teen-age car thief at the height of Newark's stolen-car plague nearly 18 months ago was portrayed in court today as a man so frustrated by the brazenness of the city's young thieves that he used a stolen, unlicensed gun to get even.

Back From the Nuclear Brink
description: For years, the Soviet Union said it would use nuclear arms only in retaliation against a nuclear attack. But its military posture and practices never corresponded to that stated policy. Soviet forces stood poised to unleash a devastating strike at a moment's notice.

title: New N.C.A.A. Director To Continue Changes
description: Hailed as a man of integrity and vision as he was introduced as the next executive director of the National Collegiate Athletic Association yesterday, CEDRIC DEMPSEY, the University of Arizona athletic director, pledged to continue on the road of change charted by his predecessor, DICK SCHULTZ.

title: Clinton Opposes Amendment Requiring a Balanced Budget
description: President Clinton informed Congress today that he opposed a proposed constitutional amendment to require a balanced budget, asserting that "it would promote political gridlock and would endanger our economic recovery."

description: The Serbian authorities have arrested 18 leaders of a Serbian militia, charging them with murder, rape, kidnapping and illegal arms possession, the republic's Police Ministry announced late Thursday.

description: Disclosures that King Hussein of Jordan met secretly this week with Foreign Minister Shimon Peres of Israel intensified already considerable speculation here today that the two countries have moved closer to an eventual peace agreement.
