title: Parents of Dead Child Say They Suspected Abuse by Nanny
description: The parents of a 10-month-old who died of injuries received while in a nanny's care have testified that they suspected the baby was being abused, but ignored their fears because of their trust in the nanny and the reassurances of their pediatrician and a relative.

title: Never Too Young for Tennis Millions
description: Over the summer, she completed her second season as the prime phenomenon-in-residence at Rick Macci's cozy, well-regarded tennis academy in Delray Beach, Fla. During the United States Open, she suddenly moved to the sprawling high-tech, Marine-paced training facility operated by Nick Bollettieri, where she jostled for court space with a handful of the planet's hottest prodigies.

title: Smith Is Sidelined With a Sore Left Knee
description: Charles Smith, the Knicks' starting small forward, will be out at least 7 to 10 days because of soreness in his left knee.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Vouchers Become Hot Tickets for Russian Bulls
description: The great Russian bear -- the investor variety -- has turned into a bull.

title: Coleman-Anderson Tandem Beats Jackson and Mashburn
description: After losing a big chunk of their offense for the second game in a row, the New Jersey Nets found some more of their defense and fought off the young and pesky Dallas Mavericks tonight, to come away from Reunion Arena with an 86-80 victory.

title: House Panel to Examine Arkansas S.&L. Failure
description: The chairman of the House Banking Committee said today that his panel would investigate the failure of an Arkansas savings and loan owned by a former business partner and political patron of President Clinton.

title: Emons Holdings Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings were less than 1 cent a share.Emons Holdings attributed first-quarter results in part to a 6.5 percent decline in carloads and a 4 percent increase in costs.

title: Trade Center Witness Tells of Manuals on Bombs
description: Six large-format books with blue-green covers containing writing in both Arabic and English and, most importantly, diagrams on bomb-making, were at the center of testimony in the World Trade Center trial yesterday.

title: Nordstrom Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Amre Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 26
description: b-Net income

title: GRAZING FEES CUT FROM SENATE BILL
description: Unable to break a filibuster by Western lawmakers, the Senate today abandoned its effort to raise grazing fees and tighten environmental rules for use of Federal lands. But in doing so, it freed the Clinton Administration to impose even higher grazing fees and stricter environmental regulations on its own.

title: LIMITED INC. (N)
description: The slump in sales of women's clothing battered Limited Inc. in the third quarter.

title: Varco International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss, and the quarter included a charge of $ 4.9 million relating to the closing of a manufacturing facility.Varco International said that the year-to-year revenue increase is a result of its acquisition of the Shaffer division in July 1992. Shaffer contributed $ 35.3 million of revenue during the first nine months of this year, compared with $ 6.3 million during the period between its acquisition and Sept. 30 of last year.

title: Showdown on the Brady Bill
description: There's a chance today for the House of Representatives to pass the simple, fair Brady handgun bill and take a big step toward the safety from uncontrolled weapons sales the public yearns for. Auspiciously, the Senate is committed to a vote on the bill and for the first time a President is eager to sign it.

title: Dateq Information Network Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Thermo Voltek Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: Share earnings were adjusted to reflect a 3-for-2 stock split distributed in November 1993.The company is a unit of Thermedics Inc. and Thermo Electron Corp.

title: A Haven for Hopeless Causes; Devotions to St. Jude Are Growing, Manhattan Church Says
description: Clutching rosaries or wrinkled prayer cards, thousands of urban pilgrims filed through the sanctuary of St. Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic Church over the course of a recent week, seeking answers to the impossible -- chronic illnesses, broken marriages, lost jobs -- or just a glimpse of happiness. Laborers and executives, blacks and whites, young and old sat together during prayers, lining up afterward for a blessing from a relic of St. Jude, the patron saint of impossible causes.

title: Magical Poufs of Air, Souffles Become Even More Elusive
description: SOUFFLES belong to a different era of French cooking, along with coq au vin and canard a l'orange, traditional dishes knocked off their pedestals by nouvelle cuisine.

title: Melange of Flavorings Transforms a Fish Dish
description: FUSION cooking seems to be the newest catchall phrase for dishes with ingredients from more than one part of the world. Generally, one of the countries is the United States or France, and the other is Asian.

title: CHRONICLE
description: CALVIN KLEIN sewed up the fashion industry's two most prestigious honors yesterday. The Council of Fashion Designers of America named him the women's wear designer of the year and the men's wear designer of the year, the first time both awards have gone to one person in the same year. The awards area to be presented at Lincoln Center on Feb. 7, 1994.

title: House Panel Told Alaska Pipeline Is Troubled and Risks Breakdown
description: The director of the Federal agency that regulates the Trans Alaska Pipeline yesterday harshly criticized the way the pipeline is run and told a House subcommittee that his agency had already taken action to correct some deficiencies.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Guided by Voices Under Acme

title: 13 Parties Qualify for Russian Ballot
description: Campaigning for Russia's parliamentary elections began today after 13 political groups received permission to put up candidates.

title: School Aide Joins I.B.M.
description: Stanley S. Litow, the top aide to Joseph A. Fernandez during his tenure as New York City Schools Chancellor, will join I.B.M. as director of corporate support programs. The company is the largest corporate contributor to philanthropy in the country. Mr. Litow, 47, will take over his new post on Monday. He will also have responsibility for the I.B.M. International Foundation and its South Africa Projects Fund, which supports education and legal reforms and promotes black enterprise there. Mr. Litow was brought to the Board of Education by Mr. Fernandez in 1990 as deputy chancellor for operations.

title: Giuliani Offers an Olive Branch To Cool Views on Staten Island
description: Trying to cool the secessionist fever of a borough that was crucial to his mayoral victory, Mayor-elect Rudolph W. Giuliani yesterday promised an administration more sensitive to the needs of Staten Island and invited the Borough President to suggest ideas for restructuring New York City's government.

title: Friedman Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gain of $ 77,000, or 1 cent a share, from the cumulative effect of accounting changes.

title: Sports of The Times; Chuvalo's Life After Boxing
description: HE was 34 then, a heavyweight with a chin that seemed to have been transplanted from the Canadian Rockies. In 90 fights over 18 years, he would never be knocked down in the ring. Not when George Foreman battered him in three rounds. Not when Joe Frazier broke his cheekbone in four.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Beneficial Corp., Wilmington, Del., is selling through UBS Securities Inc. $100 million of 6.47 percent medium-term notes due in 2008 at various prices, initially at 100 to yield about 85 basis points more than Treasury securities with a similar maturity. The notes are rated A-2 by Moody's and A by S.& P. and Duff & Phelps.

title: Barrett Business Services Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Barrett Business Services said that it reported pro forma net income of $ 702,000, or 22 cents a share, in the third quarter 1993, compared with net income of $ 435,000, or 22 cent a share, in third quarter 1992.The company reported pro forma net income of $ 1,574,000, or 64 cents a share, in the first 9 months of 1993, compared with $ 1,096,000, or 55 cents a share, in the year-ago period.Barrett said the pro forma results reflect provisions for federal and state income taxes as if the company were treated as a C corporation. Effective April 30, 1993, the company converted from an S corporation to a C corporation.

title: Enforcement Problems May Help Cable Systems Sidestep Rate Rules
description: Thousands of cable television systems across the country may escape new Federal price regulations because many cities and towns are afraid that enforcing the rules will create more problems than it solves.

title: Mexicans Seethe With Anger At Perot's Depiction of Them
description: After weeks in which Mexicans seemed to hold their anger at criticism of their country by opponents of the North American Free Trade Agreement in the United States, they fairly exploded today at Ross Perot's depiction of Mexico the night before.

title: Roger B. Dooley; Writer and Teacher, 73
description: Roger B. Dooley, a writer, teacher and film scholar, died on Oct. 29 at St. Clare's Hospital in Manhattan. He was 73.

title: A Judge Finds His Credibility Is Questioned
description: A year and a half ago Justice Flemming L. Norcott Jr. of the Connecticut Appellate Court enjoyed an embarrassment of judicial riches. Gov. Lowell P. Weicker wanted to elevate him to the state's Supreme Court, and Senator Christopher Dodd was equally eager to place him on the Federal District Court in Connecticut, where he would be its first black ever.

title: Dudley Out 6 Weeks After Breaking Ankle
description: CHRIS DUDLEY, whose signing by the Portland Trail Blazers prompted a National Basketball Association challenge in court, will be out at least six weeks after breaking his ankle in only his third game with the club.

title: Dorel Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Wainoco Oil reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: A Thousand Days and 30 Years; From Man to Martyr to Myth
description: THIRTY years after John Fitzgerald Kennedy's murder in Dallas on Nov. 22, 1963, Americans continue to hold the 35th President in improbably high regard  not just as a man of star quality, whose life was cut short in a moment whose origins are still debated, but as a national leader ranked in some polls with or above Abraham Lincoln and Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: METRO DIGEST WHITMAN, AND ROLLINS, DENY PAYMENTS New Jersey's Governor-elect, Christine Todd Whitman, said it was not true that her campaign had made payments to suppress the urban and mostly black vote in the New Jersey governor's race. In a retraction and apology she demanded, her campaign manager, Edward J. Rollins Jr., said in a statement that he had exaggerated and that the payments "did not occur." A1. Republican loyalists are furious at Rollins's comments. B10.

title: Gaston de Havenon; Art Dealer, 89
description: Gaston de Havenon, a dealer and collector who specialized in African art, died on Sunday at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center. He was 89 and had homes in Manhattan and East Hampton, L.I.

title: 'Family Planning': Baby Boy or Girl?
description: IN the fourth month of her second pregnancy, the ultrasound screen shadows revealed an unmistakable fact: Joan Wisner-Carlson was carrying another boy. "I guess we're going for a third child" were the first words her husband, Bob, a psychiatrist, said.

title: CHRONICLE
description: ALFRED EISENSTAEDT, the photographer, turns 95 on Dec. 6, but the flurry of celebrations and tributes is already under way. Tonight, for example, the American Jewish Committee will present him with its 1993 Human Relations Award at a dinner in the New York Hilton Hotel. More parties are on tap for Dec. 4, 6 and 7, two of them at the Circle Gallery in SoHo, where 95 of his photographs will be on display.

title: Home Oil Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: ACE Ltd.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and at the end of fiscal 1992, ACE implemented a new loss reserving methodology. As a result, net income for the fourth quarter ended Sept. 30, 1992 was adversely impacted by an additional loss provision of $ 236 million which was recorded with respect to losses relating to premiums earned in years prior to 1992.ACE said that income excluding realized gains was $ 32.1 million, or 64 cents a share, and $ 125.2 million, or $ 3.08 a share, for the latest quarter and year, respectively, compared with a loss of $ 208.3 million for the year-ago quarter and $ 125.5 million for the year.

title: Prudential Fraud Scandal Reaches to Parent Company
description: The fraud scandal at Prudential Securities has reached the doorstep of its parent company, the Prudential Insurance Company of America.

title: A Town Is Hopeful That a Girl Still Lives
description: Almost three months after 12-year-old Sara Anne Wood disappeared while riding her bicycle, residents of this small community say they still believe she will be found alive. They also say their sense of security may never return.

title: Bridge
description: Everyone knows that Friday the 13th is an unlucky date, but it is not clear how this applies at the bridge table. North-South and East-West cannot be unlucky simultaneously, and somebody must win the duplicate game. The diagramed deal was played on Friday, Aug. 13, at the Adventures in Bridge Club in San Diego. It was reported by Woody Douglas of that city, and although he modestly does not admit it, he was probably the declarer.

title: Anatol Dinbergs, 82, Latvia's Ambassador
description: Dr. Anatol Dinbergs, who recently retired as Latvia's Ambassador to the United States, died on Tuesday at his home in Washington. He was 82.

title: Deaths Involving Fireplaces And Wood Stoves Are Up
description: THE No. 1 cause of fatal residential fires is smoking materials' coming in contact with upholstery and bedding, said Richard Bukowski, senior research engineer at the National Institute of Standards and Technology in Gaithersburg, Md.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Bjork Webster Hall

title: Lands' End Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,300,000, or 7 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: Liggett Joins In Price Rise
description: The Liggett Group Inc. told distributors today that it would raise prices on branded cigarettes by about 4 cents a pack, following a similar move by the R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company, a unit of the RJR Nabisco Holdings Corporation, earlier this week.

title: Gilbert Associates (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-After a charge of $ 200,000 from a cumulative effect of changes in accounting principles.Revenue represented consolidated revenues.

title: Landeta and Dolphins Get Together
description: Sean Landeta is in Florida -- and he is not going to Disneyworld.

title: Arizona Land Income Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: A Big Room in SoHo, Full of Earth
description: THE Earth Room is a big roomful of dirt. Dirt as in dirt farming. Good dirt, as black as the Mississippi Delta. It looks like a rich plowed field that has somehow flung itself onto the second floor of an industrial building in SoHo.

title: FEDERATED DEPARTMENT STORES INC. (N)
description: Excluding one-time tax adjustments, Federated Department Stores milked more profits out of lackluster sales in the third quarter than analysts had expected.

title: 2 AT STATE DEPT. ARE OUT OVER FILES
description: Secretary of State Warren Christopher has dismissed two mid-ranking State Department employees, apparently for their role in searching the personnel files of 160 former Bush Administration officials, the State Department announced today.

title: Vista Resources Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $ 418,000, or 11 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Vons Companies reports earnings for 16wks to Oct 10
description: b-Included a one-time pretax charge of $ 56.9 million related to restructuring program, an extraordinary charge of $ 1.4 million on debt refinancing, and an extraordinary charge of $ 2 million for higher taxes under new federal tax laws.c-Net incomed-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 12.7 million on debt refinancing, and after a charge of $ 15.5 million from the cumulative effect of change in accounting for retiree medical benefits.Year-ago periods ended Oct. 4.

title: WNYC's Public Broadcast Stations Nearly Sustain Themselves
description: To the Editor:

title: Economic Scene; Russia is quietly dismantling socialism at a remarkable pace.
description: BY some accounts, Russia's dash for capitalism has stalled. The central bank, controlled by old-line bureaucrats, is still pumping out inflationary rubles to keep hopelessly inefficient enterprises in business. And to judge by the soothing pre-election words from Prime Minister Viktor S. Chernomyrdin, fiscal cold turkey may not be on Boris N. Yeltsin's post-election menu.

title: Gold Adds Glitter to Remote Russian Region
description: On Kamchatka, a peninsula on Russia's Pacific coast, a tin of caviar costs three cents. But that's just for the empty tin.

title: Pride Cos.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gain of $ 1.5 million, or 15 cents a unit, for change in accounting method in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included charge of $ 3.6 million from another accounting change.c-Net lossShare earnings are in units.

title: Boston Globe Review Narrowed to 6 Shops
description: The Boston Globe said yesterday that it had narrowed the review on its estimated $4 million account to six semifinalists from a list of 16 contenders. The account had been at Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos in Boston for 15 years, until the company and agency decided to part ways last month.

title: Public & Private; Over and Out
description: I've got an idea for a modification to the North American Free Trade Agreement: we'll send Ross Perot to Mexico and in return we'll give the Mexicans anything they want as the gift of a grateful nation.

title: China Austerity Drive Is Hurting U.S. Ventures
description: Last summer, when thousands of regional Communist Party bankers were printing money to finance their capitalist dreams, China's leaders in Beijing clamped down with an austerity drive to rein in a runaway economy.

title: Atlantic Tele-Network Inc.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss which reflects operating loss from discontinued operations, net of income tax benefit, of $ 857,000 and $ 1,533,000 in the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and a loss of $ 1,617,000 which reflects provision for loss on disposal of discontinued operations, net of income tax benefit, in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included a gain of $ 1,729,000, or 14 cents a share.c-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 104,000 and $ 409,000 in the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and a one-time gain for the sale of real property, which amounted to $ 1.4 million pretax, or 7 cents a share after tax, in the quarter and 9 months.

title: Euro Disney '93: $901 Million Loss
description: Walt Disney said today that it had agreed to pump money into Euro Disney "for a limited period" while the European park seeks financing from banks. The size of the capital injection being sought was not specified, and a spokesman could not be reached for comment.

title: Israel Ready to Curtail Force In Gaza Strip, the P.L.O. Says
description: Israel has agreed to drastically reduce its forces outside Jewish settlements in the Gaza Strip, raising hopes that the Dec. 13 deadline for carrying out limited Palestinian self-rule will be met, the chief Palestinian negotiator said today.

title: Its Economy Rising, Morocco Lures Investors
description: For several weeks, Kerry Yeager, a project manager for the AES power corporation of Arlington, Va., has been hunkered down in a suite at the Hyatt here hammering out the terms of the biggest American investment ever in Morocco.

title: Review/Television; To Let a Thousand Bull Markets Bloom
description: After watching Adam Smith's two-part series on the Chinese economy, the first impulse is to invest, to get in on the ground floor of China's booming, astonishing economy.

title: Duracraft Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Salvador Is Accused of Reneging on Police Pledge
description: The Government of El Salvador is resisting the dissolution of the country's paramilitary National Police and its replacement by a new civilian police force, a change agreed to in the peace accord that ended 12 years of civil war here, diplomats say.

title: 2 Held in Bombing Of Firefighter Crew
description: Two more people were arrested yesterday on charges they helped make an explosive that was thrown into a fire engine on July 8, injuring three firefighters in Washington Heights.

title: H&H Oil Tool (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Censorship Won't Make U.S. Any Less Violent; Knowing What's Fake
description: To the Editor:

title: An American Sets Her Sights High
description: They're both blue-eyed blondes with short-cropped hair, and if that doesn't make it hard enough to tell them apart, consider this: Whether on the road or on the track, Anne Marie Letko and Uta Pippig often seem to be joined at the hip, running in virtual lockstep and invariably finishing within a few seconds of each other.

title: Many Markets Open Today
description: Most banks and the Treasury bond market will be closed in the United States today in observance of Veterans Day. But the stock market and the commodity markets will be open. And there will be limited trading in the currency markets.

title: U.S. to Release Data on Secret Nuclear Tests
description: As part of an overhaul of cold-war-era rules, the Energy Department has decided to declassify reams of previously secret information about the nation's nuclear weapons, including data about undisclosed nuclear tests, Administration officials said Monday.

title: Buffett Raises Stake
description: Warren E. Buffett raised his stake in Wells Fargo & Company within the last week to 12.2 percent, according to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Mr. Buffett, chairman of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., purchased 304,400 shares worth about $33 million between Nov. 3 and Nov. 8 at $106.1 to $109.35 a share, according to the filing.

title:
CURRENTS;
Whither the Little Black Box?
description: PHILIPPE STARCK, France's top furniture designer, has conjured up his own image of entertainment in the 21st century. "We will have the technological know-how to project images independent of a television set," he said, "which will make the current black box obsolete."

title: Canstar Sports (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax gain of $ 1.2 million, or 6 cents a share, resulting from the settlement of a claim Canstar had made relating to the purchase of the Cooper hockey business in 1990 for the quarter and 9 months.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: TV Debate Set A Cable Record
description: The debate over the North American Free Trade Agreement on CNN was seen in 11.2 million homes, the largest audience for any regularly scheduled program in the history of cable television, according to the A. C. Nielsen rating service.

title: Confronting Fires of the Heart and Mind
description: Six days before my home in the Malibu hills was destroyed by fire, I spent the morning hours packing for a trip to New York, occasionally pausing to watch television coverage of the first round of blazes that were still burning in Laguna Beach, 60 miles to the south, and in Thousand Oaks, nearly 30 miles north.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Bolshoi Symphony Orchestra Brooklyn Center for the Performing Arts Brooklyn College

title: Future Now Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Future Now said that its earnings growth during the 9 months period is reflected by the dilutive effect of the company's July 1992 issuance of 1,638,377 common shares to Intelligent Electronics Inc. in exchange for Intelligent's nine computer reselling operations, and the company's March issuance of 1,467,500 shares in a public offering.The company also said during the third quarter it finalized the acquisition of Irvine, Calif.-based Premium Connecting Point and Basicomputer Corp. of Akron, Ohio.

title: Corrections
description: A table on Nov. 4 headed "A Portrait of New Jersey Voters," based on a survey of voters leaving polling places around that state, mislabeled a column of figures showing the comparative size of each demographic group in a past election. The election used for comparison was that of 1990, not 1989.

title: Emotion Rules TV Debate on Puerto Rican Vote
description: With Puerto Ricans set to vote on Sunday on whether they want statehood, independence or a continuation of commonwealth status, leaders of the island's three main political parties resorted to emotional appeals in a crucial televised debate on Tuesday night, their last chance to address uncommitted voters en masse.

title: Terex Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 80 million gain resulting from the deconsolidation of its former subsidiary, Fruehauf Trailer Corp., in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included a loss of $ 65.6 million attributable to Fruehauf's second-quarter results, including a noncash restructuring provision of $ 47.5 million.c-Net lossLatest periods' results included those of Fruehauf Trailer Corp. on an equity basis, and the year-ago periods included results of Fruehauf Trailer on a consolidated basis.

title: Garden Q.& A.
description: Corsican Mint

title: Doctor Indicted in Arson After Office Is Destroyed
description: A former Long Island doctor whose wife was fined $170,000 for performing faulty mammograms was arraigned today in Federal District Court in Brooklyn on a charge of setting fire to a six-story building where 70 families were sleeping.

title: Vote by Teachers in Boston Averts a Strike
description: Averting a strike that had been called for Friday, the Boston Teachers union voted today to approve its first contract in three years.

title: Censorship Won't Make U.S. Any Less Violent
description: To the Editor:

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-17 CLINTON WEIGHS ISRAEL SPY CASE President Clinton said that Prime Minister Rabin of Israel had written to ask him to shorten the prison term of an American Jew convicted of spying for Israel in 1987 and sentenced to life in prison. A1

title: House Approves a Five-Day Wait Before Buyers Can Get Handguns
description: The House today approved legislation that would require a buyer of a handgun to wait five business days before taking possession of it, but only after adding an amendment that would end the requirement after five years.

title: Power and Glory: Thomas Is M.V.P.
description: Although Buck Showalter, the Yankees' manager, didn't have a vote, he cast his ballot for the American League's most valuable player last August when he ordered Frank Thomas walked intentionally in the first inning. Showalter, like other managers, didn't want to let Thomas beat him, whether it was the ninth inning or the first inning.

title: If the Officials Strike, Will Mayhem Arrive?
description: Although there aren't any games scheduled tomorrow in the National Hockey League, the referees and linesmen will meet in Toronto to make an important judgment call. As a union, they will vote on a "final set" of salary numbers proposed by the league.

title: Diana Corp. reports earnings for 12wks to Oct 16
description: b-Net incomec-Included an extraordinary gain of $ 436,000, or 13 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 1,129,000, or 32 cents a share, in the 6 months.

title: K-Tel International Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: K-Tel International said that the improvement in net income for the latest quarter is primarily attributable to continued strong music sales in the U.S. and lower foreign currency transaction losses than those experienced in the year-ago first quarter.

title: Queens Experiment to Fight School Violence
description: A pilot program to reduce violence in public schools will begin early next year at five sites in Queens, New York City school and law-enforcement officials said yesterday. The school-safety plan, they said, is generally consistent with ones made by Mayor-elect Rudolph W. Giuliani.

title: Thorne Rejoins Mets
description: GARY THORNE, who called Mets radio games from 1985 to 1988 rejoined the team yesterday and will call at least 65 games on WWOR-TV/Channel 9 and 25 to 30 on WFAN-AM radio.

title: Obscure images in Metropolitan Home's campaign may be art, but can they convert the clueless?
description: ALL right, let's try to figure out what's going on here.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: International

title: McEnroe, Agassi Out
description: JOHN McENROE, who has not been invited, and ANDRE AGASSI, who is under suspension, won't be playing for the United States Davis Cup team in its first-round match in India next March, but captain TOM GULLIKSON didn't rule out anybody else on a list that includes PATRICK McENROE and IVAN LENDL, now an American citizen. India will announce the site, probably Madras or Bombay, and surface, probably grass, on Dec. 3, and Gullikson will wait until then to reveal his team.

title: Nuevo Energy Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included charge of $ 115,000 relating to increase in federal corporate taxes.

title: PARENT & CHILD
description: AFTER his mother turned down his request to buy a particular item, a 9-year-old boy approached his father and asked if they might speak privately in the kitchen for a moment. The father, who realized what was going on, listened patiently to his son's request, and then asked him what his mother had said. "What's the matter?" the boy asked. "Can't you think for yourself?"

title: Editorial Notebook: Almost Forgotten on Veterans Day; Wilson's Failed Vision Still Has Wings
description: Just 75 years ago today, the guns fell silent in what an older generation called the Great War. That so little has been made of the anniversary reflects the heartbreaking letdown that clings to the memory of World War I.

title: Ministers Deny Taking Money From Republicans
description: Black ministers across New Jersey expressed shock and anger today over the assertions, later retracted, that they had accepted up to $500,000 from Christine Todd Whitman's successful campaign for governor to remain politically neutral before last week's election.

title: Clinton Is Asked By Rabin to Cut Spy's Jail Term
description: President Clinton said today that Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of Israel had asked him to shorten the prison term of an American Jew who was convicted of spying for Israel in 1987 and sentenced to life in prison.

title: Tel Aviv Journal; A Spirited Play, to Rattle Israel's Religious Sabers
description: Aryeh Fleischer, who survived the Holocaust and fought for the young State of Israel, owns a butcher shop, and not a successful one.

title: Interco Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 150,653,000 for the quarter and $ 143,828,000 for the 9 months, in pretax gains from costs, expenses and related interest income resulting from Chapter 11 reorganization, net of fair value adjustments resulting from implementation of fresh-start reporting. The periods also included gain of $ 1,049,922,000 from extinguishment of debt, net of cumulative effect of accounting change for postretirement benefits other than pensions and income taxes.The company said the year-ago share earnings and shares outstanding for the quarter and 9 months are not meaningful due to cancellation of all shares of preferred and common stock outstanding prior to the company's emergence from Chapter 11.

title: Shoring Up Limp Joints On Frames
description: PROVIDED they are of sound wood and simple in form, flagging picture or mirror frames can be easily strengthened and tightened by anyone with average hand skills. It is not a good idea, though, to try repairs if there is a possibility of harming a fine body of pristine gilt. Give that work to a professional frame restorer.

title: Judge Rules That Sheik and Two Other Defendants Cannot Share Lawyers
description: Ruling that Sheik Omar Abdel Rahman did not understand the peril of his lawyers' "one-size-fits-all defense," a Federal judge has decided that the Egyptian cleric charged with directing a terrorist plot to bomb New York City targets cannot be represented by the same pair of lawyers defending two others in the case.

title: House G.O.P. Proposes 'Tough Love' Welfare Requiring Recipients to Work
description: House Republicans struck first today in what promises to be a divisive debate over welfare, unveiling a plan they called "tough love" to make welfare recipients spend 35 hours a week working off their benefits.

title: WOOLWORTH CORP. (N)
description: The Woolworth Corporation lost $452 million in the third quarter, mainly because of its previously announced restructuring charge of $480 million. Excluding the charge, Woolworth would have earned $28 million, or 23 cents a share. Last year, Woolworth earned $65 million, or 50 cents a share, in the third quarter. Sales in the quarter ended Oct. 30 fell 4.6 percent, to $2.39 billion

title: Vishay Intertechnology Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $ 1,427,000, or 7 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.The latest periods included restructuring charges of $ 1,738,000 in the quarter and $ 3,730,000 in the 9 months, related to the downsizing of some of the company's European operations.Share earnings reflected a 5 percent stock dividend paid on June 11, 1993.The company said that sales rose in the latest quarter and 9 months from the year-ago periods because of the acquisition of Roederstein GmbH, effective Jan. 1, 1993.

title: Despite Cheekbone Surgery, Hasty Says He Is Ready to Play
description: James Hasty is either a crazy man or an iron man. Two days after having surgery to repair a broken left cheekbone, the Jets cornerback said he wants to play against the Colts on Sunday.

title: Florio's Defeat Revives Memories of G.O.P. Activities in 1981
description: For the second time in a little more than a decade, Gov. Jim Florio has lost close races for governor in elections that produced charges that Republicans went to extraordinary lengths to keep black voters away from the polls.

title: JAPANESE PREMIER FACING MAJOR TEST
description: A hundred days after taking office and promising the most sweeping political change in postwar Japan, Prime Minister Morihiro Hosokawa still enjoys the highest approval rating in the history of Japanese polling but faces a critical test within the next few days getting the first of his biggest reform plans approved by Parliament.

title: G. F. Verbeck Jr., 80, Retired Bank Executive
description: Guido F. Verbeck Jr., a retired executive of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company in New York, died on Monday at his home in West Tisbury, Mass. He was 80.

title: Adequate Insurance Against a Disaster
description: IS your house fully covered against a fire or a natural disaster? Even if you bought the broadest form of homeowners' policy, you may not have enough coverage. Nearly a third of the homes destroyed in the fires in Oakland, Calif., in 1991 were underinsured, according to the California Department of Insurance.

title: Transactions
description: Baseball American League

title: Turner Broadcasting System reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a net extraordinary charge of $ 6 million for early termination of a portion of the company's bank credit facilities and the redemption of its convertible debt due 2004, in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months was also after a charge of $ 306 million from the cumulative effect of a change in method of accounting for income taxes.c-Net incomeYear-ago periods restated to conform with the 1993 presentation.

title: Devils, Somehow, Pull Off A Victory
description: The Devils had two of their defensemen ejected from the game tonight. They fell behind by two goals. They appeared doomed in their first game at home after four on the road.

title: Continental Mortgage reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary gain on sale of real estate of $ 365,000, or 12 cents a share.c-Net income

title: RHI Entertainment Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30

CURRENTS;
Styles of the Black Upper Class
description: FROM a slave to a barber to one of the first black millionaires. An exhibition called "The Herndons: Style and Substance of the Black Upper Class in Atlanta, 1880-1930," traces the rags to riches story of Alonzo Herndon, shown at right with his family, who founded the Atlanta Life Insurance Company in 1905.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: TENNIS Lendl Is Still Slipping Ivan Lendl is still having trouble with that first step. Unseeded Brett Steven of New Zealand, ranked 44th in the world, handed Lendl his 11th first-round defeat in 26 tournaments this year, eliminating the world's former No. 1 player, 6-4, 1-6, 6-1, from the European Community Championship in Antwerp, Belgium, yesterday. (AP) N.H.L. Flyers Stymie Sabres Mikael Renberg scored the Philadelphia Flyer's first two goals in a 5-3 victory last night in Buffalo that kept the Sabres the only team without a victory at home this season. Gary Galley, Mike Recchi and Eric Lindros scored the other goals for the Flyers. Buffalo, 0-7 at home this season, got goals from Derek Plante, Craig Simpson and Pat LaFontaine. The Sabres have lost six straight in the Memorial Auditorium for the first time. (AP)

title: Intergroup Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Cecilia Brinton Bogner; Psychologist, 93
description: Cecilia Brinton Bogner, a retired Boston psychologist, died on Oct. 31 at Sherrill House, a Boston nursing home. She was 93 and lived in Lincoln, Mass.

title: Monk-Austin Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 1.6 million from changes in accounting for income taxes and retirement benefits.

title: Stifel Financial Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: Share figures reflected 5 percent stock dividends on Sept. 9, 1992, and Sept. 14, 1993.

title: Japan Never Ceded Islands Russia Claims
description: To the Editor:

title:
CURRENTS;
Cozy Tearoom Tucked Into Babies Hospital
description: ONE of the most elaborate tearooms in Manhattan is run exclusively for children. Not just any children, but the patients of the pediatric cardiac and neurology unit at Babies Hospital at the Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center. The tearoom is the fantasy of Claire Pace, an interior designer and chef, standing above. Mrs. Pace spends two days each week baking cakes and making sandwiches, and each Wednesday sets off from her house in Lloyd Harbor, L.I., with her best china, freshly cut flowers and tablecloths.

title: Perini Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a $ 4.6 million pretax gain from the sale of Majestic Cotractors Ltd., the company's 74 percent-owned Canadian unit. The gain nets to zero after certain accounting and tax issues.Latest results reflected payments to preferred shareholders of about 13 cents a share in the quarter and 38 cents a share in the 9 months.Perini said that 1992 third-quarter results reflected ''excellent'' operating results from pipeline operations which were sold in 1993's first quarter; dollar figures for these discontinued operations were not immediately available.The company also said that it acquired another contruction firm's interest in certain construction projects and certain equipment under a transaction accounted for as a purchase.If this acquisition had been consummated as of Jan. 1, 1992, the pro forma results would have been: net income in the third quarter of 1992 of $ 3,213,000, or 65 cents a share, on revenues of $ 313 million; net income in the 9 months of 1992 of $ 6,707,000, or $ 1.26 a share, on revenues of $ 843,981,000; and net income in the first 9 months of 1993 of $ 2,735,000, or 27 cents a share, on revenues of $ 898,406,000.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Vintage Petroleum reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $ 1,725,000, or 8 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Events: Shows, Benefits, Lectures
description: Antiques and Movies Piers 88, 90 and 92, 12th Avenue between 48th and 55th streets; (212) 691-7297.

title: Moynihan Recommends 3 to Be Federal Judges
description: A former state judge, a top Federal prosecutor and a lawyer in private practice were recommended by Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan yesterday to become Federal judges in the Southern District of New York.

title: New Home Option: Surviving Flames
description: Watching the television images of brush fires engulfing the canyons of Southern California, most viewers probably had mixed emotions: awe at the scale of destruction, and relief that they were safe from risk.

title: Drug Found to Stall Failure of Kidneys In Some Diabetics
description: In a finding that elated researchers, a large study has shown that a drug used to treat high blood pressure can sharply slow progression to kidney failure in diabetics.

title: TRUMP AND CASINO INVESTORS AGREE TO FINANCIAL PLAN
description: Donald J. Trump has reached a tentative agreement with investors in Trump Taj Mahal Associates to restructure the debt and equity of the Atlantic City casino complex. The transaction will allow Mr. Trump to buy out partnership interests that he does not already own and to pay some personal debt. The restructuring, which must be cleared by Government regulators and the Taj board, would reduce the company's long-term debt to $692 million.

title: Penrod Scofield; Illustrator and Muralist, 60
description: Penrod Scofield, an illustrator and a muralist, died on Friday at St. Johns Hospital in Yonkers. He was 60.

title: A Battle Over Whitbread Women's Boat
description: The takeover on Tuesday of the U.S. Women's Challenge, the 60-foot yacht entered by Nance Frank in the Whitbread Round the World Race, has produced a bitter struggle ashore over rights to the boat.

title: Husband Acquitted of Assault in Mutilation Case
description: John Wayne Bobbitt, the self-described ordinary ex-marine who found himself under a national spotlight after his wife sliced off his penis, was acquitted today on a charge of marital sexual assault.

title: United Plan to Cut Costs Without Union Aid
description: With time apparently running out on an effort by United Airlines' unions to take over the carrier, United executives yesterday detailed their plan to lower costs without help from labor.

title: Many in G.O.P. Are Angry At New Race-Related Woe
description: After years in which Republicans have been portrayed by their opponents as a white people's party that practices electoral dirty tricks, party loyalists seethed with fury and frustration today over a public account by a G.O.P. renegade of campaign tactics in New Jersey.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Joao Bosco S.O.B.'s A solo concert of bossa novas usually brings hushed, poetic ruminations, and Joao Bosco's show on Sunday night at S.O.B.'s had its share of whispered endearments. But in its own quiet way, Mr. Bosco's magnificent set, the first United States appearance since 1991 by one of Rio de Janeiro's finest songwriters, was also a joyful display of rhythms in which his guitar said as much as his voice did. He sang about everything from love and longing to impressions of France to the deities of the African-Brazilian religion Candomble.

title: Review/Dance; Works by Maxine Sherman
description: Maxine Sherman, a former lead dancer in the companies of Alvin Ailey and Martha Graham, is a performer who seems to hold nothing back, sometimes to almost frightening effect. And three of the four new and recent dances she presented on Saturday night at the Merce Cunningham Studio were blessed with that same open spirit.

title: Review/Music: 'Cinderella'; City Opera Tries On The Famed Footwear
description: If there is one character in fairy- tale lore who is a prime Rodgers-and-Hammerstein-style heroine, it is Cinderella, a cockeyed optimist who climbs every mountain until she finds her dream. That is probably why Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein 2d had to think for only five minutes before agreeing to create a musical version of the tale for CBS television in 1957.

title: Daly Candidate For the Hall
description: By early February, the Nets could have a Hall of Famer for a coach. Chuck Daly was one of 11 candidates announced by the Honors Committee yesterday as eligible for induction into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame next May 9 in Springfield, Mass. The inductees, who need 18 of 24 votes, will be announced on Feb. 8.

title: 2,200 Job Cuts Plus Charge At BellSouth
description: Setting the stage for its first-ever quarterly loss, the BellSouth Corporation said yesterday that it would take a $1.2 billion charge against earnings and reduce its work force by an additional 2,200 jobs by the end of 1996.

title: PennCorp Financial Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Excluding realized gains, after-tax earnings from operations for the three- and nine-month periods ended Sept. 30, 1992, on a pro forma basis were $ 5.3 million and $ 16.1 milion, or 29 cents, and 88 cents a share, respectively. Pro forma amounts give effect to the company's refinancing plan completed Nov. 5, 1992, as if the plan had occurred on Jan. 1, 1992.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption yesterday about the repair of a boardwalk on the New Jersey shore misidentified the locale. It was Ocean Grove, not Bradley Beach.

title: Essay; Gore Flattens Perot
description: Are you going to keep interrupting, or can I finish this column?

title: Different Wars, the Same Sadness
description: While I was researching a story in Israel and the occupied territories in 1986, I began photographing disabled veterans from Middle Eastern conflicts. Since then I have documented the stories of former soldiers in 11 countries around the world.

title: Swann Lost for Season
description: ERIC SWANN, the Phoenix Cardinals' most dominant defensive lineman, will miss the rest of the season after undergoing arthroscopic surgery yesterday to repair cartilage in his right knee. The Cardinals said their estimate of a four-week recuperation period had to be lengthened after the team orthopedic physician, RUSSELL CHICK, discovered and repaired lateral meniscus cartilage torn Sunday during a 16-3 victory over Philadelphia. (AP)

title: BellSouth Deal on QVC Is Said to Be Imminent
description: QVC Network Inc. and the BellSouth Corporation are expected to announce as early as today that BellSouth has agreed to invest $1.5 billion in QVC's hostile bid for Paramount Communications Inc., according to several executives with knowledge of the discussions.

title: Perot Stake Under Pact Is Not Clear
description: A business owned by Ross Perot that became a central point of contention in his debate with Vice President Gore on Tuesday night told the Commerce Department earlier this year that it intended to take advantage of the surge in trading that would follow passage of the North American Free Trade Agreement.

title: Books of The Times; A Strong Gay Dissent On Public Spectacles
description: A Place at the Table The Gay Individual in American Society By Bruce Bawer 269 pages. Poseidon Press. $21.

title: More Phones for Subway Stops, But Most Will Not Accept Coins
description: New York Telephone will increase the number of phones in the subway system by 150 percent over the next few months, adding an average of 7 new phones per station to give subway riders better access to '911' emergency services, the company said yesterday.

title: Strike at French Airline
description: Employees of Air Inter, the state-owned French domestic carrier, which is a subsidiary of Air France, staged a 24-hour strike today, causing delays of up to two hours for departing flights but no cancellations, the Paris airports authority said. The flights of other airlines have not been affected, a spokeswoman for Aeroports de Paris, Claire Billaud, said. She said some Air Inter workers had occupied the runways at Orly Airport for about a half-hour earlier this morning, but had since left.

title: House Proud
description: WE walk all over them. Cover them wall-to-wall with chemically treated wool or polyester. Sand the character lines from their venerable surfaces and throw down a tasseled dhurrie. If only floors were walls, people might pay them a little more respect.

title: Contraceptive Maker to Charge Clinics Less
description: Under pressure from family planning groups who say that the high price of Norplant, the contraceptive implant, has prevented hundreds of thousands of women from obtaining it, the manufacturer announced today that it would sharply cut the price it charges public clinics.

title: Questioning Focuses on One Defendant
description: Who exactly is Ahmad M. Ajaj and what was he doing with four passports in four different names, two photo identification cards and six large books full of information about weaponry and bomb-making?

title: Mexican Stocks Soar After TV Debate in U.S.
description: After what was widely seen here as a tough and effective defense of the North American Free Trade Agreement by Vice President Al Gore in Tuesday night's debate with Ross Perot, the Mexican stock market today turned in its strongest performance of the year.

title: BUDGET BALANCER IS FACING A DELAY
description: Reluctant to thwart their colleagues' desire to adjourn by Thanksgiving, supporters of a constitutional amendment to require a balanced budget have agreed to put off action on it until February.

title: Belden & Blake Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results reflects pro forma results, as if the consolidation which formed the company on March 31, 1992, had been completed on Jan. 1, 1992.Belden & Blake said that the increase in net income for the latest third-quarter earnings is due to the additional revenue generated from producing properties and gathering systems in West Virginia acquired in December 1992.

title: New President Hired By Saatchi Agency
description: Jeff Atlas, formerly the chairman at what is now Citron Haligman Bedacarre in San Francisco, yesterday landed a top position at Saatchi & Saatchi Advertising in San Francisco, after eight months working on his own.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption on Nov. 1 about a debate between candidates for Nassau County Executive, and a correction in this space on Nov. 3, reversed the identities of some participants. From the left were Helene B. Agatstein, Thomas S. Gulotta (the incumbent), Benjamin Zwirn, an unidentified man, at the rear, and Charles E. Holster 3d. The caption and the correction also misstated the site of the debate. It was Woodbury, L.I.

title: BOTH SIDES ASSERT GAIN AFTER DEBATE OVER TRADE ACCORD
description: The feuding over the fate of the North American Free Trade Agreement grew louder and more shrill today as the vote in Congress edged closer.

title: Whitman Denies Report by Aide That Campaign Paid Off Blacks
description: Stern-faced and clearly angry, Gov.-elect Christine Todd Whitman said today that it was not true that her campaign had made payments to suppress the urban and mostly black vote in the New Jersey governor's race.

title: Cuomo Says He Won't Support Trade Pact
description: After refusing for months to take a firm position on the North American Free Trade Agreement, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo of New York said today that he could not support the proposed treaty in its current form.

title: Washington Memo; Still Waiting for the Real Health Care Shoe to Drop
description: The Clinton Administration's health care plan has been leaked, launched and relaunched, but it has yet to be formally introduced in Congress.

title: Gielgud's Inspiration
description: To The Home Section:

title: No Headline
description: "How is it possible that he can say everyone lives in poverty here? Before he opens his mouth, he ought to come down here and take a look." -- LUIS ESTRADA, a Mexico City lawyer, on Ross Perot. [ A1:5. ]

title: Sam Davidman; Hotelier, 71
description: Sam Davidman, a retired Catskills hotelier, died on Sunday at Mount Sinai Medical Center. He was 71 and lived in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: U.S. and Others Press Fight for U.N. Rights Chief
description: The United States and a group of more than 20 Western and developing countries have decided to press ahead with a plan to create a new post of High Commissioner for Human Rights after a key United Nations committee said it was deadlocked on the proposal.

title: The Nafta Debate That Wasn't
description: It wasn't exactly what the Founding Fathers had in mind when they spoke of reasoned political discourse, nor was it what Al Gore and Ross Perot presumably have in mind when they tout the mediating powers of the electronic town hall. Instead, Tuesday's Big Debate over Nafta was a frightful mishmash of rhetorical false starts and logical inconsistencies. It would be nice to say that the evening was redeemed by civility, but it wasn't.

title: Borg Calls It Quits
description: BJORN BORG says he has finally decided to quit top-level tennis after losing a tense match with ALEKSANDR VOLKOV of Russia in the latest stage of a disappointing comeback attempt. Borg, the Swedish star who returned to the game in 1991 after eight years away but never came close to recapturing his old brilliance, said he was finally calling it a day after making an early exit from the Kremlin Cup tournament in Moscow. Borg, 37, squandered a match point and lost by 4-6, 6-3, 7-6 to Volkov in the $325,000 tournament. (Reuters)

title: Pilgrimage to End With Honors
description: Before there was this trip to a place where their son had celebrated life, there had to be a sad pilgrimage to where Drazen Petrovic had met his tragic death.

title: Naples Ready to Elect a Mayor, but Does It Matter?
description: It's voting season here, and everywhere the Neapolitans look they are being offered a choice for Mayor -- a neo-Fascist or an ex-Communist or a candidate from one of the many hybrid tickets reflecting Italy's confusion-of-the-hour.

title: One Generation's Icons
description: To the Editor:

title: Investigate in New Jersey
description: The very thought of Republican operatives spreading money around New Jersey's black communities to suppress the turnout on Election Day is so ugly it beggars belief. Indeed, Christine Todd Whitman's campaign manager, Ed Rollins, now says he was not telling the truth when he confessed to that practice on Tuesday.

title: Records Set for 8 Artists as Auction Fever Returns
description: The collectors and dealers at Sotheby's sale of contemporary art last night went to shop. And a determined group they were. As at Christie's on Tuesday night, even insignificant artworks sold, and sold well. But last night, prices often soared to more than double the estimates, setting records for eight artists.

title:
CURRENTS;
User-Friendly Garden Tools
description: "WE call them sneakers for your hands," said Betsey Wells Farber, the design director of the Oxo company. She was referring to a set of garden tools called Good Grips, which were developed for easy use.

title: Balkan War Imperils 4.2 Million Lives, U.S. Says
description: The State Department estimated today that the lives of more than 4.2 million people in the former Yugoslavia are "at risk" this winter because of fighting, disease, malnutrition or lack of shelter.

title: State Dept. Seeking Funds of Other Agencies
description: Faced with the erosion of its foreign aid budget, the State Department has begun a campaign in the Administration to direct funds from other Federal agencies into foreign assistance programs.

title: Nuclear Storage Divides Apaches and Neighbors
description: The laser-guided saws at the Mescalero Apaches' lumber company turn out 16 million board-feet a year. The tribe's cattle company raises 7,000 head. Ski Apache draws 250,000 visitors annually, and the 440-room Inn of the Mountain Gods, with a convention center, golf course, Casino Apache and two artificial lakes, is humming.

title: The Roar of Tanks Fades Out Where G.I.'s Guarded Europe
description: Where the largest tank brigade in the United States Army was once stationed, there is now only a vast, empty parking lot, barracks and a vacant 8,000-acre training area that the Second Brigade of the Third Infantry Division will soon turn back to the Germans.

title: A Victory on Workplace Harassment
description: A victim of sexual harassment need not suffer a nervous breakdown to sue an employer for discrimination. A worker has suffered enough, the Supreme Court asserts, if the employer has so polluted the workplace with sexual improprieties that a reasonable person would find it hostile and abusive, a disagreeable, unpromising place to work.

title: Veterans Day
description: NEW YORK PARADE The Veterans Day Parade begins at 9 A.M. at Fifth Avenue and 39th Street, going south to 24th Street. Fifth Avenue will be closed from 9 A.M. until completion of the parade. GOVERNMENT OFFICES Closed.

title: Dr. Richard H. Thurm; Heart Specialist, 67
description: Dr. Richard H. Thurm, a retired medical internist and heart specialist who helped develop drugs to regulate blood pressure and control other problems of hypertension, died yesterday at his home in Princeton. He was 67.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: J. I. CASE CO., Racine, Wis., and the United Automobile Workers union, along with the Case U.A.W. Council, jointly announced the ratification of a 16-month contract extension, which will run from Oct. 3, 1993, to Feb. 4, 1995.

title: Clinton Pushing Business With Asia
description: Seeking to capitalize on the world's fastest-growing economies, the Clinton Administration is pushing to topple trade barriers in East Asia, increase export subsidies and persuade United States companies to overcome their traditional reluctance to expand in the region.

title: Goal: Integration by Consensus; Weak Gesture or Trojan Horse? Connecticut Is Divided
description: Connecticut is about to call on its 169 towns and cities to do what no state has ever asked: to cooperate in creating, from the local level up, a statewide plan for integrating public schools.

title: 2 Roster Cuts Send A Message To Giants
description: The Giants' weight room is normally a loud and raucous place, but players said it was unusually quiet -- and tense -- this morning. Many were in shock about how suddenly two veteran teammates, punter Sean Landeta and linebacker Steve DeOssie, were cut from the team. It happened so suddenly some players didn't even know.

title: A 'Bazaar' Way of Rounding Up Votes
description: Vice President Al Gore and Ross Perot may reap credit for the success or failure of the North American Free Trade Agreement, but the truth is that its fate lies more in the hands of Florida tomato growers.

title: Hampshire Group Ltd. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-After a gain of $ 1,300,000, or 39 cents a share, from implementation of FASB 109 and a $ 1.5 million provision for consolidation of hosiery operations.c-After an extraordinary charge of $ 57,000 from prepayment penalty on retirement of long-term debt, related to the company's going public in June 1992.Year-ago quarter and 9 months ended Sept. 26.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Igor Kipnis Fortepianist Kaye Playhouse Hunter College

title: U.S. and Switzerland to Share Seized $22 Million
description: After five years of negotiations, the United States and Switzerland are splitting $22 million in profits seized from the Swiss bank accounts of the leader of a Long Island-based hashish ring.

title: I.B.M. Ships New Version Of OS/2 Operating Software
description: I.B.M. said today that it was shipping a version of its OS/2 operating system software aimed at customers who already own a copy of the Windows program made by the Microsoft Corporation.

title: Nine U.S. Tourists Killed in British Bus Crash
description: A bus filled with American and Canadian tourists skidded off a major highway during a rainstorm and plunged down an embankment 10 miles west of here this morning, killing nine Americans, including three from Connecticut, and the British driver. Dozens more were injured.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption on Tuesday about an exhibition at Socrates Sculpture Park in Queens misstated the location of the park in some editions. It is Long Island City, not Astoria.

title: Pacific Telesis to Announce Video Network
description: The Pacific Telesis Corporation, the regional Bell company based in San Francisco, intends to announce a sweeping plan Thursday to spend about $15 billion over the next five years to build a network capable of delivering television and high-speed data services throughout California.

title: Farm Credit System reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary loss on repurchase of debt of $ 9,000,000 and a net gain of $ 103,000,000, which included a gain of $ 135 million for change in accounting for income taxes and charge of $ 32 million for change in accounting for postretirement benefits other than pensions.c-After a charge of $ 37,000,000 from an accounting adjustment.Farm Credit System said the latest quarter included gains on other property owned of $ 3 million, compared with $ 4 million, in year-ago period, while the latest 9 months had gains on other property owned of $ 5 million, compared with $ 6 million, a year-ago.

title: Dinkins Can't Quite Forget Politics
description: In a weeklong vacation here, Mayor David N. Dinkins has played up to three tennis matches a day and even lost "a pound or two."

title: THE FREE TRADE ACCORD: Beyond a Trade Pact; The Issue: Should the U.S. Expand Its Economic and Political Influence?
description: The political debate over the North American Free Trade Agreement is not about tariffs or domestic content rules or side agreements on labor and the environment. It is not even mostly about trade with Mexico.

title: U.S. Robotics (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: The latest periods' share earnings included a gain of 3 cents a share on the disposition of Communications Research Group on Oct. 1.

title: Woods to Stanford
description: TIGER WOODS, the youngest player to compete on the PGA Tour, signed a letter of intent yesterday to attend Stanford. Woods, 17, of Cypress, Calif., is the only three-time winner of the United States Junior championship. A senior at Western High School in nearby Anaheim, the teen-age sensation chose Stanford over Nevada-Las Vega and Arizona State.

title: Review/Dance; On Soaring and, Inevitably, Falling
description: The Paul Taylor Dance Company closed its engagement at City Center on Sunday night with a program that began as a celebration, turned into a memorial and concluded as an affirmation.

title: Eagles Claim Perry
description: The Philadelphia Eagles claimed tackle WILLIAM (REFRIGERATOR) PERRY yesterday in an effort to bolster their leaky rushing defense. The Chicago Bears waived the 335-pound lineman Tuesday after nine years with the team. Eagles Coach RICH KOTITE said Perry would play Sunday against the Miami Dolphins. (AP)

title: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings are in American Depositary Receipt. Each ADR represents 10 ordinary shares.

title: Patience Pays Off For Irish Passer
description: A season was about to begin, and Kevin McDougal was out of a job. That was the coach's decision. This was the quarterback's final chance.

title: Review/Cabaret; American Pop, but With a French Accent
description: In the most uproarious moment of "Les Incroyables," a streamlined hybrid of the Folies-Bergere and a contemporary drag show, Daniel Rohou, a portly transvestite clown who looks like Divine, leads a corps of dancers in a recreation of routines from Madonna's Blond Ambition tour. There is something poignant as well as ridiculous in the sight of the fleshy comic performer making a deliberate fool of himself while executing a narcissistic model's poses for Vogue. Especially in those moments featuring Mr. Rohou, "Les Incroyables" is more than just entertaining: it feels liberating.

title: Slain Taxi Driver Knew Danger but Drove On
description: If Sindulfo Perez ever felt invulnerable to the dangers of the taxi business, his fellow livery drivers were frightful reminders. One still bore the scars from a beating over the head, and another from the time a passenger slit his throat. Mr. Perez never stopped feeling for his colleagues and, his friends said, he never stopped feeling afraid for himself.

title: Brascade Resources reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.Brascade said Noranda Inc.'s earnings were off due to a $ 60 million loss recorded on the sale of its stake in MacMillan Bloedel Ltd. and a $ 125 million reduction in its mining and metal earnings.The company is a subsidiary of Brascan Ltd.

title: When Voters Tell Polls They're Undecided
description: To the Editor:

title: Review/Pop; Jackson Browne Returns To the Private Domain
description: Unlike most rock stars' careers, which move in fairly straight lines, Jackson Browne's has taken an unusually circuitous path. This Los Angeles singer and songwriter, who on Tuesday evening gave the first of his three concerts this week at the Nederlander Theater in Manhattan, has just released "I'm Alive" (Elektra), a recording of searching personal love songs that are very close in style and feeling to those on his 1974 album, "Late for the Sky." And on Tuesday, the 45-year-old singer, who seems hardly to have aged over two decades, performed a brilliant, low-key concert in which the artistic powers that seemed to be deserting him during much of the 1980's were back in full force.

title: Consumer Prices, Reflecting New Gasoline Tax, Rise 0.4%
description: Reflecting a higher gasoline tax and other special factors, consumer prices climbed four-tenths of 1 percent in October, the biggest advance in six months, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Cairn Energy USA Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Thermo Electron Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-After a charge of $ 1,438,000 from an adjustment in accounting.Share earnings and shares outstanding were adjusted for 3-for-1 stock split distributed in October.

title: Calendar: Treasured Objects
description: Eye of the Beholder Guggenheim Museum SoHo, 575 Broadway (Prince Street); (212) 423-3500.

title: Review/Dance; Joffrey Offers a Rock Ballet to Songs by Prince
description: "Billboards" is four choreographers' ballets rolled into one, danced magnificently by the Joffrey Ballet to the recorded music of a composer identified in the Brooklyn Academy of Music's current program as Prince Rogers Nelson.

title: Bonds Retreat on Price Index Rise
description: The bond market retreated yesterday and long-term interest rates rose after the Government reported news on inflation that disappointed traders and investors.

title: All American Semiconductor Inc.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Executive Changes
description: JOY TECHNOLOGIES INC., Pittsburgh, a maker and supplier of air pollution and ash-handling equipment, named John Nils Hanson president and chief operating officer.

title: Cyclicals Set the Pace, With Dow Up by 23.48
description: Surmounting its gnawing fear of rising interest rates, the stock market yesterday cobbled together its first major rally in more than a week.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Yale Music Spectrum Merkin Concert Hall

title: Great Pass, Key Goal and the Unbeaten Streak Goes On
description: The play was one of trust as much as technique or design. Adam Graves, his back to the goal, turned and slid a blind pass back through the slot. Tony Amonte, not a regular on the club's top line, was where he should have been; where Graves gambled he would be.

title: Thermo Cardiosystems
description: Shares of Thermo Cardiosystems Inc., a manufacturer of implantable devices that help ailing hearts to pump, rose yesterday after the company said Federal regulators would review its products, a significant step toward getting them approved for commercial use. The value of the stock has doubled since June.

title: Tussauds Considers Wax Exhibition in Times Square
description: Add a new ingredient to the bubbling stew on 42d Street: wax.

title: GULF TROOPS' ILLS BEWILDER DOCTORS
description: The Pentagon said today that there was no connection between low levels of chemicals reportedly detected by allied forces in the Persian Gulf war and mysterious illnesses now afflicting many veterans.

title: James Yates, 87, Head Of N.A.A.C.P. Chapter
description: James Yates, who went from the cotton fields of Mississippi to the battlefields of the Spanish Civil War and the New York civil rights fights, died on Sunday in Beth Israel Hospital in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Market Place; A Fight for Green Point's Pot of Gold
description: In the 125 years since it was founded, Green Point Savings Bank of Flushing, Queens, has accumulated a giant pot of gold -- retained earnings of $758 million.

title:
CURRENTS;
Hollywood Fantasies For Sale
description: THE golden age of films may be over, but the glamorous artifacts from the Hollywood dream factory live on. The Manhattan Antiques and Collectibles' Triple Pier Expo will salute the movie industry with a display of costumes and film-making equipment on Nov. 20 and 21. On Nov. 13 and 14, 200 dealers will sell items including an issue of Playboy featuring Marilyn Monroe ($5,400) and a porcelain statuette of the blond bombshell ($300).

title: View on Sports Betting
description: The N.B.A. commissioner, DAVID STERN, says the entry of the new expansion franchise in Toronto is conditional on not having betting on N.B.A. games in the province of Ontario.

title: Knicks Overcome 4th-Quarter Drought and Bullets
description: When the Knicks were good tonight, they were very good. When they were bad, they were awful.

title: A Court in Nigeria Declares Interim Government Is Illegal
description: A federal judge ruled today that the interim Government appointed by Nigeria's dictator, Gen. Ibrahim Babangida, was illegal.

title: Paramount To Acquire Macmillan
description: In a merger that would bring together two prominent names in New York publishing, Paramount Communications Inc., the parent company of Simon & Schuster, agreed yesterday to buy Macmillan Inc., the 150-year-old company that publishes such writers as Edith Wharton, Ernest Hemingway and F. Scott Fitzgerald.

title: Review/Theater: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat; Joseph And His Brothers, To Music
description: The most interesting fable at work in the flashy revival of "Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat," the first collaboration by Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber, isn't the familiar biblical tale from which the musical takes its plot. It is, instead, a show-biz saga of lost innocence, the story of how a modest, tuneful little musical from the 1960's grew and grew, through successive incarnations, into an oversized, glittering symbol of the Age of Hype.

title: MicroAge Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
GOODRICH TO ACQUIRE ROSEMOUNT AEROSPACE
description: The B. F. Goodrich Company said yesterday that it would acquire Rosemount Aerospace, a producer of aerospace sensors, from the Emerson Electric Company for $300 million. The transaction would be the largest acquisition in Goodrich's history, surpassing the acquisition of the Cleveland Pneumatic Company, a maker of aircraft landing gear, for $200 million in June, the company said.

title: Russians Wonder if Revolt's Casualties Were Higher Than Reported
description: In a country that voraciously devours conspiracy theories, the relatively low death toll in the showdown last month between President Boris N. Yeltsin and his opponents has become a matter of considerable conjecture.

title: SunAmerica Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest periods included investment losses of $ 7,746,000 in the quarter and $ 21,287,000 in the year, compared with year-ago investment losses of $ 7,317,000 in the quarter and $ 56,364,000 in the year.

title: Louis Banks, 77, Dies; An Editor for Time Inc.
description: Louis Banks, a former managing editor of Fortune magazine and former editorial director of Time Inc., died on Sunday at his home in Naples, Fla. He was 77.

title: Rutgers Is on Road to Nowhere in 1993
description: A visitor ran into Doug Graber earlier this week and greeted him with a cheery "How's it going?" After a half second of strained silence, the visitor caught himself and quickly revised the greeting. "Well, how's the wife and kids?"

title: NCR AND WELLS FARGO ARMORED SERVICE IN A.T.M. VENTURE
description: The NCR Corporation and the Wells Fargo Armored Service Corporation said yesterday that they would jointly sell and service automated teller machines nationwide. Under the agreement, NCR will install and maintain the units, while Wells Fargo Armored, based in Atlanta, will replenish cash reservoirs, transfer deposits and repair card and currency jams. NCR, based in Dayton, Ohio, is a unit of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

title: INSIDE
description: A Giant Publisher Emerges

title: Corrections
description: An article on Sunday about doctors' incomes misstated the affiliation of Dr. Albert D. Roberts. He is with the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center in Dallas, not Houston.

title: AT WORK WITH: Paul Binder; A Big Top With a Vision to Match
description: FADO, the 5-year-old chestnut Lusitano stallion that had the impertinence to bite the founder and artistic director of the Big Apple Circus, was behaving himself this afternoon. Fado was floating proudly in a slow practice canter under a near-empty circus tent, kicking up a tracery of sawdust in the ring. "That's where he took a bite out of me," Paul Binder said, rolling up his sleeve to reveal a large arm marked with a large dark bruise.

description: To the Editor:

title: Symmetricom
description: Shares in Symmetricom Inc., an electronics manufacturer specializing in telephone equipment, plunged yesterday in heavy trading after the company said its earnings would be lower than expected for the 1994 fiscal year because of reduced demand for its products. The stock had slumped in early October before rebounding recently.

title: I.B.M. May Sell Federal Systems Unit
description: I.B.M. said yesterday that it was exploring the sale of all or part of its Federal Systems Company.

title: Is It Art? Just Ask Any Child
description: NEW YORK CITY, very early Saturday morning. The parents of young children have awakened to the alarming sound of a clock that's signaling a dash toward a little-league soccer game, or to the cheerful, high-pitched plaints of you-know-who. A long day looms.

title: A Disneyland of History Next to the Real Thing
description: To the shock and utter exuberance of many in this thoroughly rural village 35 miles from the White House, the Walt Disney Company unwrapped plans today for a new amusement park that would relive the grand sweep of American history. Only better, of course.

title: Pope Fractures His Shoulder
description: Pope John Paul II fractured and dislocated his right shoulder today after tripping on the hem of his robe, and is spending a night in a hospital, the Vatican said.

description: With 1.14 million copies in print, "Private Parts," the raunchy autobiography of a foul-mouthed radio personality, Howard Stern, has been getting a lot of public exposure. But its publisher says it is nowhere to be found at several large discount department-store chains.

The Jets' punter said he thought his phone would ring on Wednesday morning and a voice would tell him to report to Coach Bruce Coslet's office. Time to Think
